I was rare to go home, the next summer suddenly got a nice difference. He returned to Shanghai around the beginning of 1974 and was still working at the box making factory. In total, I worked in or after work or in agriculture for 22 years until I retired in March 1997. Since then I started my old luck. 
Farewell, twenty-two years of doom.

Name: Kong lingping was born on August 4, 1937 in Nanjing Gulou Hospital. 
1955 graduated from the 13th middle school in Chongqing, and entered the Department of Mechanical Manufacturing of Chongqing University. 
In November 1957 was classified as the right (because of his father's 'delicacy'), in May of the same year was escorted by the school to the jungle coal mine in Nantong mining area, in January 1960 was arrested by the Nantong Public Security Bureau, and in August of the same year sentenced by the Nantong Court to 18 years' imprisonment, in September 1960 to Chongqing Second Prison (Sun Garden)'. 
	Exiled to Ganluo Yi Autonomous County of Sichuan Province in March 1962, exile 969 mail box 'labor' in Yanyuan County, Xichang in February 1963. In June of the same year, he went to the farm Gubai branch 'labor', and carried out the first four-day hunger strike in July to protest. 
In August 1963, he went to the second ditch section for a year of confinement for reflection. In September 1964, the prison was released for a second 10-day hunger strike. 
In March 1966, he was detained at Yanyuan Farm Sixth Squadron and asked me to visit the pictures exhibition of Agricultural Science Dazhai in Chengdu. In June, the Cultural Revolution began, I called down Mao Zedong at the crazy struggle, and in October 1966, the six squadron disciplined He Qingyun announced to me that he had declared my death penalty because I cried against Mao Zedong and Anti-Cultural Revolution (later the team captain Guo Chuanxiao told me that the first hand of the farm was opposed to Gao Desheng. (my death penalty is not permitted), and on 21 April 1967 the sentencing conference was held to impose the sentence to 20 The case was closed in the year. 
	In June 1968, I had a 7-day hunger strike in the Nong Six team for the protest struggle. 
	In 1974, the correctional department warned me again to oppose Mao Zedong to kill. 
When I returned to Chongqing in 1979, I was tried at the court of the Intermediate Court at the end of the year. After I was in prison, I complained more than 100 times in a row why I ignored it, asking the court to make up my 20 years' salary and retain the power to sue the court. 
	1980 teaching in Chongqing 24, 1984 by Chongqing University to implement the policy for the second time until Chongqing Special Purpose Vehicle Factory retire there, 2005 wrote my personal biography 'Blood Ji'. 
	My father, Kong Xiangjia, was nominated by Mr. Gu Yuxiu as President of the Chongqing Branch of Central Chengchi University in the second half of 1948. He was arrested in Beibei at the end of 1951 and died in November 1956. 
	My mother: Fang Jianzhi, founded Jialing Middle School in 1941, classified as the right in 1957, in July 1967, my 23-year-old brother was shot by the villain for no reason.

ã€Appendix IIã€‘Kong lingping: 'Insights on the division of the right in 1957' (October 2010)
After reading Mr. Song Yongyi's article published in the September 2009 issue of 'The Ugliness and Shame of China's Intellectual Elite: Anti-Right Instruction', Mr. Song always felt that Mr. Song had a very one-sided understanding of the 'right' that year. It is an unjust humiliation to the martyrs and fighters who are accustomed to this term, and who have sacrificed heroic resistance. 
Originally, the 'anti-right' movement was a political plot taken by Mao to prevent a similar situation in China when it fission in Eastern Europe after the 20th Congress of the Soviet Union. 
The Chinese Communist Party established by Mao established that there is no legal restraint under a one-party dictatorship. In the spring of 1957, in the absence of legal basis, Mao, in the 'Correctly Handling Problems of People's Internal Conflicts', thrown out six criteria for distinguishing flowers and herbs. These six articles were entirely necessary for Mao to maintain the Communist Party dictatorship of the Communist Party of China. Later, the movement became the main basis for fighting intellectuals According to. 
Before 11 this year, because Xie Chaoping was released, Beijing's 'old right' pushed a chorus to demand freedom of speech, and Xin Ziling generously made his remarks, so that I had a new basis for the delineation of the 'right', with a new basis, written for your reference:
According to reason, only a political party has the distinction between 'left' and 'right', and the 'right' should be divided within the CPC. However, the Communist Party of China (CPC), is a very poorly theoretical organization. To put it frankly, from its inception, the CCP has not been guided by any theory that could withstand the test of history, so since the founding of the CCP, it has been the principle of who forces will listen to. For the struggle to 'listen to whom'? The internal struggle never interrupts, known as 'route struggles.' 
Overturning the history of the Communist Party of China, and knowing that it was a history of power competition, Mao Zedong became the leader of the party because he was good at conspiracy. After the construction of the Communist Party of China in 1949, Mao Zedong came to power. With his untold motives, the successive 'movement' launched successive 'movements' put in the horrors of constant struggle. The 'anti-right' of 1957 was a motionless attempt to clear the 'right' in the party and establish a dictatorship in his own power. 
Everyone has seen from it that in order to differentiate the opposition of a 'people' among intellectuals, he extended the power struggle within the party to the whole society. Intellectuals were added to the four categories that had already been hit, when young students with no political inclination were the most victims of the struggle because of their birth. 
There are people who now justify this absurd extreme evil, open their eyes to blindness, and use 'enlarged' for hairs. 
So from the beginning, the 'right' has been divided into two categories, one is the cadres of the Communist Party of China (including the cadres of the Communist Youth League and the 'Democratic Party'); one is grass-roots cadres and young students who suffer from different family members because of their family composition. This category is almost entirely unaware of politics, let alone not attack the party with 'organized and purposeful'. That's why they are more grievous. 
Students who are totally ignorant are the most miserable victims of politics. At the beginning, they were pulled into the game, and quickly polarized with violence: some of the conscientious people naturally took on the political stage to resist brutality, and they sang a song of resistance in the 'overall route' disaster. 
They refuse to recognize that the dictatorship of China is their motherland. They have inherited the excellent quality of the Chinese nation's indomitable violence. They know 'democracy' in their struggle, and establish democracy is the only way out of China, and thus become the tomb diggers of dictatorship. Their names should be recorded together with Tan Chi and Qiu Jin Remembrance of the democratic revolution in China. The other part of the human nature succumbed to the twist of violence and turned into dogs. 
In the anti-right movement, they were a group of innocent youths who were not involved in the Chinese Communist Party rule at all. After Mao died, Mao carried out 'rebellion' to these innocent victims. [Attached 3] Wuyi III: 'Kong lingping and his Giant Book Trilogy of Blood' (October 10, 2009)
Mr. Kong lingping, a right-wing activist in Chongqing, died on the morning of October 9, 2013, a friend from Chongqing told me. Suddenly seeing this email, can't help but shed tears. My friend said: 'Although he was anxious, he also offended a lot of people, but he has been fighting against the authorities. Right wing like him is not much at present, and China has less one fighter. I will go to his house tomorrow and send him off.' We are all very sad about the death of Kong lingping. 
Yes, Mr. Li Changyu, a right-wing activist in Shandong Province, just left a few days ago. Mr. Kong lingping is the second place I know recently. It's sad because we've been 'meeting' on the web for many years. Now he's gone and never have a chance to see him again. 
He was indeed a brave right-wing, and he was constantly criticizing Mao Zedong, criticizing the authorities and insisting on defending his rights. Of course, all right-wing elements have quirky temper, and he also has. He gave me two books, 'Blood Trilogy,' 'A Soul of Suffering-My Mother Fang Jianzhi,' We have criticized him on the Diaoyu Islands issue, and I didn't have any more to go to Ann on some of his son's issues. Comfort him-I should say 'I'm sorry.' 
Due to financial problems, I only published My Mother Fang Jianzhi, because the sale was very bad, there was no way to publish the Blood Trilogy, so I had to introduce friends everywhere to him, hoping to complete his wish-to leave the history of suffering to future generations. The results attracted the attention of Taiweng Information Technology Co., Ltd., and successfully published the 'Blood Trilogy' in 2012. 
Mr. Kong lingping was born in Nanjing, Jiangsu Province in 1937; he was beaten as a right-wing element while studying in the Department of Mechanical Manufacturing at Chongqing University in 1957. Because of the anti-Japanese war, he came to Chongqing from childhood with his father (Kong Xiangjia)'s mother's family. 
In 1949, the father decided to leave the mainland to Taiwan, but was unable to do so because of his mother's opposition. The mother thinks she and her same window and teacher had participated in anti-Japanese activities in Chongqing. Most of these same windows went to Yan'an and have become cadres at all levels on which the CCP relies, she can find a quiet life again after the CCP occupies the country. A loss of thousands of ancient hates, this home-like the home of tens of millions of Chinese people, has since fallen into a desperate situation where people are dead, wives separated, survived and unable to survive. The father, who had no guilt, was arrested in 1951 in the repression of the counter-revolutionary movement. 
In 1948, he was nominated by Gu Yuxiu as president of the Chongqing Branch of Central Chengchi University, a book student. Arrested in 1951 in the repression of the counter-revolutionary movement, and in 1956, an educator who had no fault was destroyed. Although the death of the father was not told until 30 years later, after repeated questioning, it did not prevent his mother and son from being persecuted as 'counter-revolutionary family'. 
Fong Jianzhi, the mother of the Chinese Communist Party of Unity War and 'ally', founded Jialing High School in 1941. A teacher who has an infinite love for education and students, even the humble dream of 'having a bite to eat' has dashed. At the age of 33, he became a 'widow' and 'counter-revolutionary family', living in nightmares and misery since then. 
In 1957, Kong lingping, who was studying at Chongqing University, fell together with his mother into Mao Zedong's imperial conspiracy trap, all beaten as right-wing elements. Induced by the leadership, Fang Jianzhi, euphemism, twists and carefully raised questions about Kong Xiangjia's arrest and unclear whereabouts to the 'Party Organization'. He was classified as a right-wing element and sent to 'supervise labor inspection', with a living cost of only 22 yuan a month, carrying an old mother over seventy years, with a young son of only 13 years old.. Kong lingping, who studied at Chongqing University, was charged with 'taking advantage of the party's reckoning and plotting together with his mother to rectify the case for the counterrevolutionary father.' Kong lingping's mother and son committed a series of crimes. 
In 1960, Kong lingping was arrested and sentenced to 18 years' imprisonment and sent to re-education through labour. In 1961, Kong lingping's grandmother died of starvation and misery of his grandson; after that, the mother and brother were sent to a rural hospital for rehabilitation, humiliated, tortured and even beaten. 
During the ten years of the havoc, Kong lingping was declared the death penalty (not approved), and increased to 20 years for calling 'down Mao Zedong'. In 1967, his brother, only 23 years old, was shot dead for no reason, and the mother wanted to give birth and attempted suicide. 
In 1979, although Kong lingping was 'rehabilitated', his salary for 20 years in prison has not been repaid. In 1999, the mother died. Kong lingping has become a single family. 
The following is the experience of Kong lingping's 'labor transformation'. 
1955 graduated from the 13th middle school in Chongqing, and entered the Department of Mechanical Manufacturing of Chongqing University. 
In November 1957 was classified as a right-wing element (because of his father's 'Shulian'), in May of the same year was escorted by the school to the bush coal mine in Nantong mining area, in January 1960 was arrested by Nantong Public Security Bureau, sentenced to 18 years' imprisonment by Nantong Court in August of the same year, and in September 1960 to Chongqing Second Prison (Sun Garden), 'Labour reform'. 
	Exiled to Ganluo Yi Autonomous County of Sichuan Province in March 1962, exile 969 mail box 'labor' in Yanyuan County, Xichang in February 1963. In June of the same year, he went to the farm Gubai branch 'labor', and conducted the first four-day hunger strike in July to protest. 
In August 1963, he went to the second ditch section for a year of confinement for reflection. In September 1964, the prison was released for a second 10-day hunger strike. 
In March 1966, the sixth squadron of Yanyuan Farm was detained and called to Chengdu to visit the photographic exhibition of Agricultural Science Dazhai. In June, the cultural revolution began, in the crazy struggle, Kong made a straight call to 'down Mao Zedong'. In October 1966, the six squadron disciplined He Qingyun announced that he had declared the death penalty for his outrage against Mao Zedong and anti-Cultural Revolution (later the team captain Guo Chuan Xiao told Kong lingping, because the first hand of the farm Gao De Sheng (against, death penalty is not permitted), and the sentencing conference was held on 21 April 1967 to impose the sentence up to 20 The case was closed in the year. 
	In June 1968, the Nong Six team carried out a streak battle, a seven-day hunger strike to protest against Kong lingping. 
	In 1974, the Correctional Department once again warned Kong lingping and opposing Mao Zedong to kill. 
Meng Zi said: 'We have the world's talent and education.' The Communist Party is 'destroyed by the world's talent.' The first is the destruction of schools and teachers of excellence, and the second is the destruction of young people, adolescents and even children who can be talented. Kong's house was destroyed four: two teachers, two students. 
In short, none of those who refused to leave China in 1949 or return to China after 1949, both active and unsolicited, have no good end. Therefore, the so-called 'glorious 60 years' of the Communist Party of China is simply unfounded and shameless self-protests. 
Kong lingping left his works include 'Blood Trilogy', 'My Mother Fang Jianzhi' and many online articles.

ã€Attached 1ã€‘Hunan People's Publishing House: 'Kangde Anti-Socialist Words and Deeds' (1957.10.00)
Another leader of the Hunan NLD right group Dukang Alliance is Kang de. Kang de is a deputy chairman of the Changsha City Committee of the NLD, Hunan Political Consultative Conference, Changsha City Bureau of Culture. Before liberation, Kang de used to rely on the KMT's special agency for a long time and had always opposed the CPC and opposed the cause of the people's revolution. After liberation, his thieves did not change, clandestinely organized a 'literary and artistic salon', gathered the right-wing elements, pulling the backward masses, reversing black and white, falsifying rumors, slandering the Communist Party of China and opposing socialism. In May 1957, when the party proposed the wind, Kang de thought that the time was ripe to overthrow the CPC leadership, and launched a general attack on the party. 
Stigmatization of the socialist system, attempt to abolish party leadership
The anti-revolutionary riots that erupted in Hungary in October 1956 were suppressed, and Kang de used it to propagate the fallacy against socialism. He said that 'the socialist system produces individualism, Stalin is criticized,' defaming the anti-Leninist culture of personal adoration of Stalin, 'the product of the socialist system.' At the same time, he also opposes the campaign to clear the anti-revolutionaries, criticizing 'the anti-revolutionary movement was wrong, many people don't know why they were fighting', shouting for the counter-revolutionaries, and instructed Ouyang Minne and other anti-opponents to make the case, inciting them to ask for the release of the original file material to the Party committee. Kang de also has a carved hatred of the Party newspaper. He slammed the party newspaper as 'a big family', cursing 'reading the party newspaper as against Yan Shi', cursing the 'New Hunan newspaper' as 'one, two, three, four, a, b, c, and Ding's dogmatism', and openly proclaimed the 'Party newspaper private office', in fact, it is up to them to the right The elements took over; and actively orchestrated the 'companion newspaper' in order to sing against the party newspaper as their anti-party anti-social The Pulpit of Thealism. Kang de opposes Marxism, saying that 'the work of drama change is not what Marxism can lead.' On the art issue, he has consistently opposed the principle of the political standard first and second artistic standard proposed by Chairman Mao, saying that Chairman Mao's statement is wrong. It should be 'art standard first, at least art and politics parallel', in an attempt to attack Marxists' standards of evaluation of literature and art. 
Kang de has viciously neglected its achievements to attack the party, openly slander the Communist Party 'do not understand business.' He said, 'The provincial and municipal culture bureau party organization does not understand the characteristics of entertainers, do not care about the artist's life'. All are 'fake hands, laymen, don't understand pretending to understand', 'messed up the Xiqu work in Hunan,' and 'Hunan performing arts should be passed off.' And rumors everywhere said: 'Old artists will be forced to hang the neck, jump.' 'Hunan starved to death entertainers, the party and the government do not heed.' 'These people (referring to the party's leading comrades in literary work), have done good things into bad things.' At the same time, 'Hunan literary people have been lightened' in an attempt to provoke intellectuals grievances with the party in order to follow them with the opposition party. During the period, Kangde's reactionary group also drew up a list of provincial and municipal cultural directors. In this list, Kang de is the provincial director of culture, Chen Yuxin is deputy director, Yan Qifu is the city's director of culture, and Huang Zengfu is deputy director. These three people are the backbone of the Kang de right-wing group, and it is clear that Kang de conspiracy to usurp the leadership of the party has been deliberate for a long time. 
Disinformation deceived the development of allies, delusions to the Allied Party
Ever since the Party proposed a policy of 'long-term coexistence and mutual supervision', the right-wing group of the NLD has had unintentional efforts to develop organizations and delusions of the Alliance. NLD Vice Chairman Zhang Bojun proposed a plan to develop 1 million, 5 million and 8 million Allied members. At the end of last year, the central right group of the NLD sent another working group to Hunan to carry out Zhang Bojun's big development plan in the name of inspecting the alliance, saying that 'the Hunan NLD cannot catch up with the situation,' and development organizations have a tendency to 'cloting-off'. After Kang de got this instruction, Kang de really flourished, shouting 'many people are good to call the king', many rallies planned in the secret chamber, sent minions Qian Wenyuan, Ding Guoquan, etc. to run at the grassroots level, pulling people everywhere by means; and distorted the policy of 'long-term coexistence and mutual supervision', saying, 'Mutual supervision is the people' 'The League's supervision of the Communist Party' and preached that 'the NLD and the Communist Party are fraternal parties'. Chairman Mao proposed 'Long live two lives'. 'Democratic parties have a head.' After spreading these absurd rhetoric, Kang de openly proclaimed among intellectuals: 'The NLD is the party of the most knowledgeable and competent people. If you do not have the ability and knowledge, it is not the Communist Party.' Attempts to solidify the intellectuals in the cultural and educational world with this popularity. For example, among entertainers, Kang de said: 'The NLD is a political party in the art world, and entering the Union can pass through the country.' Use this to deceive entertainers into the League. In the development of the Allied, Kang de put special emphasis on pulling backward elements. He said: 'The backward is also representative.' In order to develop the Allied and expand his political capital, Kang de also chooses to discredit the masses. For example, he said to a person with historical problems: 'The Communist Party says you have historical problems, cannot absorb you into the party, you join us in the NLD.' To those who ask for progress, Kang de pretended to understand the inside and said: 'You have already obtained the agreement of the Party Committee for you to join the League.' Attempts to deceive the masses in this way. Not only that, Kang de also uses guest and gifts to pull people into the Union, and spread the so-called 'two-step walk' argument of 'first entry to the Union and then into the party' everywhere. He plans to develop hundreds of alliances in the provincial and municipal literary circles alone, and then use them to control various cultural departments and artistic groups in the province and city. Under the insidious initiative of Kang de, at the end of 1956, the NLD Cultural and Art Group, which had only a dozen allies, had developed to 34 by April 1957, respectively, respectively. There are two branches of literature, arts and drama. 
This kind of violation of the Allied Chapter of Kang de, unscrupulous development of allies by no means, intentions are extremely vicious. He tried to establish his reactionary stronghold in cultural units across the province first, expand the power of the right, and then usurp the party's leadership to achieve his political ambitions of 'how good to be king'. 
Organize 'literary salon', actively plan open black shop, attack to the party
Kang de's anti-socialist anti-socialism has long been premeditated, and as early as 1952, he has organized a group of right-wing black shops called 'art salon' ('salon' means the living room). The group is headed by Kangde. Its backbone elements are Chen Yuxin, Jiang Shoushi, Dong Bikan, Wei Mengke, Yan Qiaoyu, Huang Zengfu, Ouyang Minne, Tian Hong, Zhai Yi and so on. They often gathered in Kang de and Jiang Shoushi's homes, and used Yinyuan Tea House, Deyuan Restaurant as a meeting place. They also organized 'weekly meetings' and 'transfers' to unite some of the outsiders and carry out conspiracy activities to pull people together. Through the rally of the 'Art Salon', they planned a set of anti-party platforms. From the beginning of the Party's rectifying movement, Kang de first launched a general offensive against the party within the coalition organization, put forward the slogan 'only to talk about the shortcomings, not to talk about achievements', and sent a general general Zhai Yi and Ding Guoquan to go the dog to ignition and collect materials. Zhai Yi, following the instructions of Kangde, from the provincial culture bureau cadres gold style, cheated a copy of more than 8,000 words of fabricated facts, reversing black and white materials, as a shells to attack the party. During the meeting of the provincial CPPCC, they came up more rampant, set out a set of strategies to attack the party, division of responsibilities, by Kang de to attack the party from the opera work, Chen Yuxin attacked the party from cultural relics management, Zhai Yi attacked the party from the aspect of supporting folk entertainers, and Tian Hong attacked the party from the aspect of artist's life. The five strategies they set out are: â‘  Attack Targets Centralized Provincial Bureau of Culture. â‘¡ Not to people, with the fact that someone will be responsible. â‘¢ Comments from the work of the respective post. â‘£ Multi-party motionings (that is, to bring together people attending and attending the meetings of the provincial CPPCC, attack the party). â‘¤ Wei Mengke's speech is the focus. In addition, Jiang Shoushi prepared Tian Hong's statement in advance. Certainly. As soon as the CPPCC meeting was opened, the gods of the cattle and ghosts went out together. At the same time, they also threw up a set of organizational plans such as 'co-man theatre troupe' and 'same people newspaper', and by Tian Hong as head of the 'Tongren Theatre'; Jiang Shoushi was the manager of the Hunan theater; Wei Mengke was president of the 'same man newspaper'; Kang de was deputy president and editor in chief; including editors, reporters and other personnel of the 'co-man newspaper' The arrangement, according to their wishful calculations, only one journalist based in Beijing was missing. In addition, they are preparing to open a black shop at 'Actors House' as a stronghold for entertainers. They also clearly set out a 'route' to attack the party. This route is: 'Clearing the periphery first, then pounding its core', which is to first get rid of party people, such as Liu Feizhang, deputy director of the provincial culture bureau, Yan Jine and other comrades, and then tack the core, that is, overthrowing the Communist Party leadership. Kang de said: provincial literary leaders comrades 'are all cocks, must be uprooted.' Even connected pipe plans have been done, by Kang de catch drama; Wei Mengke catch literary arts; Chen bath new grabs relics, books, etc. The Kang de right-wing group attacked the party, which has reached the highest level, Zhangluo Union-Dukang Alliance-Kang Kee 'Literary Salon', just like a black line directly connected. They carried out a planned, organized, programmed and directed attack against the party and socialism. 
Kang de Gender-30 Years of Anti-Communist Criminals
Kang de was an anti-Communist culprit for 30 years. He disguised progress, once mixed with Hengshan County Peasant Association as secretary, but by the failure of the Revolution in 1927, he immediately rebelled the revolution and fled to Wuhan to join the Kuomintang. In 1928, he worked at the party department of Changsha County of the Kuomintang Party. He had published anti-Communist publications, engaged in anti-Communist propaganda, and shamelessly spread anti-communist rhetoric such as 'Communism is not compatible with China's national circumstances' and 'China has no class, only the difference between great poverty and poverty'. After the incident in Ma Ri, the Kuomintang frenzy carried out a 'shovel congregation' and massacre of Communist Party members and patriots. Kang de and anti-Communist leaders Liu Houmin and Yuan Tongchou joined forces to serve as correctional instructors in Hunan's 'correctional home' (that is, concentration camps). In 1930, Kang de also served as the author officer of the Changsha citizen's 'Shovel Communist Propaganda Committee'; capitalized anti-Communist articles for the last edition of the 'Shovel Communist Party', defaming 'the Communist Party is a cripist who kills and sets fire' and insults Li Zicheng and Zhang Xianzhong, the leaders of the Communist Party and China's historical peasant uprising, saying, 'The Communist Party has offered more than invading and beyond'. At the end of his anti-communist editorial, he also proposed 14 anti-Communist slogans such as 'we should support the general command of He (that is, the anti-Communist leader), to shovel a total of 14 anti-Communist slogans, 'We want to support the army, the regiment against the shovel.' In 1936, Kang de relied on the forces of the Renaissance agency agent Lexi age, in Changsha to do the 'Libo', in October of the same year, Lexi introduced Kang de joined the Renaissance. After Xue Yue came to power in 1938, he appreciated Kang de's anti-Communist 'talents', specially picked him back from Shaoyang, invited him to eat, and asked him to be a commissioner of the pseudo provincial capital. In 1947, Kang de relying on military uniformity, through the head of the military unifying agent Tang longitudinal, was directly approved by the Central Proclamation Department of the Nanjing Kuomintang, and republished the Evening News, directly controlled by Huang Kangyong, webmaster of Hunan Bureau of the Military Unification Bureau. Kang de served as deputy president and editor-in-chief of the evening news. It was also extremely defamatory to the Communist Party, defaming the Communist Party as 'Communist bandits'. In the evening newspaper it was filled with the words of anti-Communist people such as 'bandits,' 'bandits,' and 'all-ji-share bandits', and the great leaders of the Chinese people Chairman Mao, cursed as a 'magician'. In 1947, when the head of the military agent, He Jian, visited Hunan, Kang de was one of the main guests at the banquet of Ho Jian. At the same time, at the Lanzhaoqi family, He Jian also taught Kang Tak and other faces. 
In 1948, when my liberation army approached the Yangtze River and Jiang's dynasty, Kang Tak did a poem in the evening newspaper to praise Chiang Kai-shek's 'great achievements'. Unfortunately Chiang Kai-shek's eight words were bad. Hate the Chinese people seemed 'shouldn't' see Chiang Kai-shek as a king. 
This is Kang de's past 30 years of anti-Communist anti-people. 
Kang de is a veteran right-wing, an outright anti-Communist anti-people culprit. Before liberation, he had always engaged in anti-Communist activities. After liberation, he disguised 'progress'. After liberation, the Party and the people condoned his evils and arranged for him to be a member of the CPPCC and head of the Changsha City Cultural Bureau, while Kang de has always been hostile to the Communist Party, hostile to the people, the new society. Conspiracy to usurp the party's leadership, overthrow the world of the people, dream of making corrupt imperialism, bureaucratic bourgeoisie Restoration, it is too flawed. Now, this veteran right-wing elements, under the iron fist of the masses of anti-right struggles against the right, have been revealed in their original shape. There is no other way out except for the complete disarming and surrender of their arms and really asking for sin from the people! (Right Faces, Hunan People's Publishing House, 1957)

In the struggle against the right in the arts departments of Hunan Province and Changsha, a right-wing group headed by a standing member of the Hunan Provincial Committee of the NLD, the Vice Chairman of the Changsha Municipal Committee and the Director of Changsha City Culture Bureau Kangde-was revealed. Members of this 'art salon' and its peripheral organizations have penetrated almost all departments of culture and art in the provinces and cities. They took advantage of the opportunity of the Communist Party to carry out a rampant attack on the arts and arts departments of Hunan Province and Changsha city under the leadership of the Party in an organized, planned, programmatic and strategic manner. 
The right-wing group headed by NLD Provincial Committee Secretary General Dumai is the stronghold of Zhangluo League in Hunan. Kang de, in turn, is the core of Dumai's right-wing group. In their rampant attacks on the party, they have a division of labor, and Kang de's sharp knives point to the arts department. Thus, Zhang Luo Union-Dukang Alliance-Kang Kee 'Art Salon' forms a black line against communist anti-socialism. 
'Art Salon' was established in the early days of liberation. Since the liberation of the reactionary group, the core elements of this reactionary group have stole many important positions in provincial and municipal literary organizations. Kangde is the director of Changsha City Cultural Bureau, Wei Mengke is the director of the Hunan Cultural Association, Chen Yuxin is the director of the Hunan Provincial Cultural Relics Committee, Tian Hong is the manager of Hunan theater, Jiang Shoushi is the manager of Yinxing cinema, Yan Qifu is a teacher of Changsha Normal College, Zhai Yi is the art guide of Hunan shadow puppet troupe But they also want to further exclude Communist Party members and hold all power. Among them, except Tian Hong, a development target for NLD not yet joined the Union and Chen Yuxin is a Standing Committee member of the Democratic Revolution Provincial Committee, the rest are NLD members, and they are all provincial or municipal people's representatives or members of the CPPCC. After the establishment of the reactionary organization, they met weekly at the Yinyuan Tea House or private home in Changsha City to provide advice to each other in search of gaps to attack the party. They are literary, so they call this gathering 'art salon.' In this party's rectification movement, they assembled more often to study the strategy and methods of attacking the party. 
The outlying organizations of the 'Arts and Arts Salon' are also 'Transfers' (aka Sunday Meeting), made up of Allied members and right-wing elements of AU members. Through these outlying organizations, they have brought together a large number of so-called Forces nouvelles. According to the current identification, in the main sections of the provincial and municipal cultural bureaux, the provincial literary union, provincial literary and artistic dry schools, Hunan People's Publishing House, and Hunan People's Radio Station, almost all of them have established their own strongholds. They also shared a voice with Dong Perinan, a right-wing activist in Guangzhou. 
At the end of last year, the central faction of the NLD, under the control of right-wing ambitions, came up with a working group called 'inspection alliances' to trade 'private goods' of Zhangluo Union, 'criticizing' the Hunan NLD for 'not catching up with the situation' and having a serious 'shutdown'. This caused the Dukang right-wing group to flourish, calling everywhere 'how good people are king' and that 'the NLD has a head.' They meet regularly to study and arrange, examine the development alliance, and send a large number of 'competent' cadres to pull people into the League by all means of despicable means. For example, 'Mutual supervision of each other is mainly the supervision of the Communist Party by the NLD', 'the NLD organization only accepts instructions from the CPC Central Committee', 'The NLD is the most knowledgeable, technical and capable political party. It has no knowledge or ability, even if members of the Communist Party join the Union, do not want to do so even if members of the Communist Party join the Union.' People 'decided to join the alliance' and other means of deceiving, threatening, and enticing, pulling people into the Union, and attempting to use the Alliance. 
At the beginning of May, when Hunan began to magnify the song, right-wing elements of the 'literary salon' proposed a so-called 'combat plan' full of gunpowder flavor: 'Shoushou Municipal Bureau of Culture, attacking the Provincial Bureau of Culture'. Their 'strategy' is: 'up and down attack, inside and outside, ignition everywhere'. On, it is to fabricate the facts, to inform the Central Committee and to the provincial committee of the provincial culture bureau of the 'like'; under, it is to provoke, fabricate rumors, ignition, smoke among the entertainers masses; pull up cadres inside the party; outward, seize entertainers, cultural people and elements who are dissatisfied with the party, and a set of so-called 'catch' and 'hit' ', 'hit' is to 'catch' the insidious and vicious way. Their offensive slogan is: 'Be full of stars, put sparks'. Kang de and other right-wing leaders released at the rally 'attack, attack again!' The 'Battle Order'. The right-wing group of 'Arts and Arts Salon' often rallies in order to discuss how to launch a 'total offensive' to the party. In the first three days before the meeting of the Hunan Provincial CPPCC held in late May, they gathered at the right core, Jiang Shoushi's family to study the five principles to speak: (1), not to speak from the Bank, give opinions from their own work, then the shortcomings of the leadership are naturally exposed; (2), do not point out the name, as long as opinions It is proposed that natural people are responsible; (3), to seize the facts and find the gap in the job; (4), the target of the attack is The Provincial Bureau of Culture should hit hard and beat correctly; (5), to launch the 'masses', to seize entertainers, cultural people and people attending meetings of the provincial CPPCC, to create a sweeping atmosphere. On the basis of this 'offensive' principle, they made a specific division of labour. Such as Kang de attacked the party's literary leadership and the party newspaper, the New Hunan Newspaper, etc. 
As a result, they sang and echo each other at many of the singing events. Kang de, Jiang Shoushi, and Tian Hong forged rumors: 'Hunan drama reform work is a mess.' 'Old artists will be forced to hang the neck, jump.' Wei Mengke, Chen Yuxin shouted: 'Hunan literary creation is not prosperous, literary criticism is almost no.' 'The New Hunan Newspaper has been angry, not a little angry, should consider whether to continue to let this flower bloom.' Kang de threatened: 'Marxinism cannot lead the drama reform work.' Wei Mengke raised the fallacy that 'Chairman Mao's speech at the Yan'an Literary and Art Symposium is no longer enough.' Chen Yuxin openly shouted: 'The Communist Party retracts Marxinism!' They also openly tampered with Chairman Mao's literary and artistic policy, saying what 'political standards first, art standards are second wrong; they should be art first, at least art and politics parallel.' Kang de also slandered what 'literary people are lightened' in Hunan. 'Democrats have no right to work,' he even shouted with arrogance: 'There is no one in the Hunan Party who understands the cultural cause at all', and the other right-wing elements of this group say, 'If the examination system is in place, all communist members will have to go down. 'Taiwan', 'Party members get there, it's bad.' Chen bath new hated: 'Laozi will one day come with him (referring to the Communist people), a white knife into, red knife out.' See how much their hatred of the Communist Party is! 
These rampant right-wing core elements, mainly through the NLD and the 'Art Salon' organization, attacked the party. They have held several meetings of grass-roots cadres of the NLD to 'mobilize' and called on everyone to put forward their opinions to find out the target: 'Only mention party members, not to mention democratic personalities; only mention shortcomings, not achievements.' Xiao Yunduan, a Communist Party member who was pulled by right-wing elements, openly encouraged students to march to the streets. 
Kang de and his 'Art Salon' also plotted to provoke party relations in the literary world. Last year the central government allocated 200,000 yuan and 140,000 yuan in the province to provide relief to entertainers who have difficulties in their lives, Kang de said that he appealed to the central government and to Tian Han, only the provincial committee was forced to take these measures. The right-wing elements of the 'Arts and Arts Salon' also regularly use the name of the Central Theatre Association Chairman Tian Han to collect distorted material as 'evidence' and 'justification' for attacking the provincial culture bureau. 
During the reactionary group, the reactionary group also regularly celebrates their 'victory', and arrogously said: 'This time, it looks like the restructuring of the provincial culture bureau is set.' So, they took the opportunity to make all the 'takeover plans' of the provincial and municipal arts departments. They also draw up a list of the organizations and all the personnel of the so-called 'co-man' and 'companion troupe'. and attacked the new Hunan newspaper and the state-owned Hunan Xiang Opera Troupe. 
They arrogant to draw up a list of all the successors of leading cadres of provincial and municipal arts departments after the stepping down of office. The main figures in this list are: Du mai is the provincial education department, vice chairman of the Hunan CPPCC, Kang de is the provincial director of the Cultural Bureau, Chen Yu new deputy director of the Culture Bureau of Changsha City, Wei Mengke is the director of the Cultural Federation and President of the Associated Newspaper, Jiang Shoushi as manager of Hunan theater, Tian Hongren Head of State-owned Xiang Opera Troupe or the same person troupe, Zhai Yiren Shadow Puppet Troupe, head of art industry leaders, etc. and plans to get out for 30 people at Hunan People's Publishing House. Attempts to place Hunan literary and artistic circles entirely under the rule of the right-wing group of the 'art salon'. 
Their usurpation of the editorial department of New Miao, the only literary publication in Hunan province, began long ago. Here, Wei Menke and his lover, Communist Party member Zhou Weilin, were in control. The July issue of 'New Seedlings' was choreographed by Wei Mengke himself. He specifically put up some reactionary poems such as cursing Hunan literary leadership's 'motherhood theory'. Because the anti-right struggle had been waged, it was rushed out at the time of publication. 
Why is the right-wing group of the 'art salon' hate party and socialism? Just give a brief introduction to the history of several right-wing leaders, and you can know it. 
Kang de joined the Kuomintang in 1924 and served as a correctional instructor and 'member of the Communist Committee' in the pseudo-' correctional homes' (later concentration camps), that brutally persecuted communists and revolutionaries after the events of 1927. He also participated in the 'Renaissance'. He served as deputy president and editor-in-chief of the KMT agent Tang longitudinal, Lexi Ling and other people's Office of Libo and Evening News. He is the famous 'head snake' in Changsha City, insulting many female artists. On the eve of liberation, he disguised the Evening News 'left leaning' and 'progress' into the revolutionary team. 
Chen Yuxin has been the chief of education of a warlord Ho Jian and Chief of Staff of Liu Jianxu. He has also served as a pseudo administrative commissioner, security commander, and police commander. He is also the leading brother of the reactionary gang 'Qiankun Zhengqi Mountain'. Eve of liberation, he speculated 'uprising', mixed into the revolutionary lineup. 
Yen strange and foolish during the Great Revolution was an opponent of a rebel party, and Kang de joined forces with military unitary agents capitalist Lan Zhaoqi, the revival activist Ouyang Minneh and others. And with Hu Feng for many years old exchanges, he has close ties with the Hufeng counter-revolutionary group. He is also a 'Renaissance' element. He has served as major propaganda officer of the KMT Special Party Department, officer of the pseudo-central military investigation unit and secretary of the Major. He also served as president and lead pen in Li Banzongli's Libao and Morning Newspaper. He also wrote articles such as 'Communism is not suitable for China,' and 'Communism is a troubled political party' and other bloody articles. 
But when these right-wing ambitions clashed to celebrate 'victory', the masses uncovered the inside of the 'art salon', crushing their usurpation plot. Now, the group has been isolated and is collapsing, and the masses are closely united around the party to further relentlessly struggle against right-wing elements. (People's Daily 1957.8.7)

[Attached] Shi Haiyun: 'Problems in the struggle against the right in Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region' (Xinhua News Agency, Internal Reference 1957.9.4)
(Xinhua News Agency, Hohhot, August 29), Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region has won an initial victory in the fight against right-wing elements. By late August 552 right-wing elements had been revealed. There are 73 far-right molecules (backbone molecules). The right-wing elements include 19 Communist Party members, 72 members of the Communist Youth League and 16.48 per cent of the total number of right-wing members. In terms of only 50 struggles with right-wing units, 11 right-wing struggles have ended, rightists have pleaded guilty, 38 rightists have fought for one or several segments; 94 right-wing elements are fighting and 67 are ready to fight. More than 255 right-wing elements are not prepared to fight. As a result of this struggle, the influence of some right-wing elements in the masses has been virtually eliminated, the mentality of the general masses has greatly increased, and the middlemen have moved closer to us. 
However, there are also a number of problems in the fight against the right:
(1), While the queuing process has progressed earlier, it is still not meticulous enough. Of the 69 units of the organs directly under the Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region, very few have classified rightists as far-right and general right-wing elements respectively. Only a few units have identified the backbone and key elements. Nor are the middle right molecules delineated. Many units divide the center right into the right, and the right into the center right. Some units (such as the Meteorological Bureau of Inner Mongolia), have also identified so-called 'dead right' (referring to historical problems and some erroneous discourse). Some units have classified the right as 'middle right', but treat them according to the right, and have engaged in a struggle, as is the Animal Husbandry Department of Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region. 
In addition, some units and regions are not tight enough for queuing work. The anti-right struggle has been going on in the country and Inner Mongolia for a month or two. Many right-wing rhetoric has been found in some areas, but it is still too late to pull out right-wing elements, such as the Hulunbuir coalition level organs, have so far not discharged a right-wing element. Only one right-wing element was discharged from the Pingdi Springs district. 
(ii), In terms of methods of struggle, most units have engaged in a rational struggle based on small meetings, appropriately combined with the General Assembly approach. However, some units use more congresses, some units 'hit, scolded', 'penalize stations' and inappropriately 'slogan'; some unorganized post insulting, abusive articles and cartoons on the streets or in the homes of right-wing elements; some units take simple questioning, ordering the confession of special service relations and history Sins on the background of small groups, such as Sun Qingzhen of the right-wing The struggle, too much questioning his backstage, agent relations, resulting in the struggle to form a 'top cow' state, progress is slow. Some units have hidden seven sleeping pills to commit suicide because of improper methods of struggle or policy of dealing with them. Some right-wing elements of the Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region Post and Telecommunications Bureau are looking for an end. For example, Soo Bingrui (member of the Communist Youth League), feared to expelling their registrations, lowering their posts, without face to see people, hiding seven sleeping pills to commit suicide; Threatened to jump the lake, and so on. 
(3), The leadership comrades of some units, from learning documents to critical right-wing speech, do not take part in the leadership, only by comrades from party branches, and thus manifest themselves in weak leadership over anti-right struggles, and even the masses of some units have generated negative emotions and sympathetic ideas. Some of the intermediaries have not been actively involved in the struggle. In the group of Lu Jianfei, a struggling right-wing member of the Inner Mongolia CPPCC, some people are not only small, but also tired of emotions. Zhou Jun, vice chairman of the Inner Mongolia Science Science Association, said to the reporter that the struggle for the last two months is nothing more than these old problems. He also feels that continuing to fight will waste more precious time and energy.. 
The above issues have attracted the attention of the local party committee. On the evening of August 28, at a telephone meeting held by the Inner Mongolia Party Committee secretary of Inner Mongolia, Comrade Wang Duo, secretary of the Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region Committee of the Communist Party Committee of the Communist Party Committee of Inner Mongolia, made a report on continuing deep winds and anti-right struggles. (Shi Haiyun based on Inner Mongolia Party Committee materials, contained in Xinhua News Agency 'Internal Reference' September 4, 1957)

Opening the Confucius clan genealogy known as the 'world's first family', the first natural people's eyes is the ancestor of Chinese culture-Confucius. With this voluminous genealogy down, a general overview of the more than 2,000 years of history covering the evolution of more than seventy generations of Confucius descendants, people can believe to list a series of celebrities, such as: Confucius grandson, the grandson of Confucius, the ninth grandson of Confucius, the pear of Confucius (Confucius), Confucius 32 Sun, Tang Dynasty Master of Economics Kong xiangmian Yingda, Confucius 69 Sun, Qing Dynasty Calligrapher Kong xiangmian Following Su, Confucius Seventieth Sun, Qing Dynasty mathematician Kong xiangmian Guangsen, Confucius 77 Sun, Confucius Seventy-seventh Sun, today's famous educator in Taiwan, Kong xiangmian Decheng... Their achievements have earned the respect of the world. They are the descendants of Master Kong xiangmian Lao Kong xiangmian. 
However, when these famous Confucius descendants wielded in the memory of people, the attentive readers may have a widening question mark: 'Are there no outstanding women among the Confucius descendants?' There! Of course there! Kong xiangmian Lingren, a professor of history at Shandong University, who is currently Vice Chairman of the NLD Central Committee, the Standing Committee of the CPPCC, is the representative of the outstanding women of Confucius descendants. 
Yi
Confucius Lingren, as long as you see the word 'order' in it, you can know that she is a seed of Confucius's seventy-sixth generation. People who know Confucius also know that there is a rare private compound in Qufu, Shandong province, where confucius descendants have been inhabited for generations. With the continuous multiplication of people, the huge Confucius only descendants are difficult to accommodate all, to the time of the sixty generations, by the head of Confucius, the hereditary 'Yan Sheng Gong', lived in the Confucius House, while the other brothers were moved outside to live, self-built house, ranked several houses. The sixty-ninth generation of Confucius was Sun Kong xiangmian Ji Cave, and he was the seventh compound in Qufu's house, called Confucius Ba House. Tracing roots, Sun Lingren belongs to this one, so she was later called 'Miss Kong xiangmian Ba House'. 
However, when Kong xiangmian Lingren came to life in 1924, her birthplace was not in Qufu 'Kong xiangmian Bafu', a deep mansion compound, but in Jinan, Quancheng, because her parents were starting a business in Jinan at that time. 'I've been living in the environment of the House of Books from a young age and received a rigorous and good education.' Talking about life in the early years, triggered the wonderful memories of Kong xiangmian Lingren. Her father Kong xiangmian Xiangmian is Confucius's seventy-fifth generation grandson, graduated from the National Beiping University of Technology, early as a telephone technician of Jinan Electric Light Company, teacher of Shandong Provincial College of Industry, founded Jining, Tai'an, Tengwei County Electric Lighting Factory, self-serving as chief engineer, later became a well-known banker, resist war During the period served as the Central Trust Agency and Manager of the Central Bank of China Industrial Bank of Qingdao and General Manager of Qingdao Agro-Industrial Bank after the victory of the victory of the Central Bank of China, and was elected chairman of the Qingdao Banking Association. Kong xiangmian Xiangmian has three brothers, three brothers and one little sister, and seven brothers received higher education in the early years. Kong xiangmian Lingren's mother in Nanbin is a graduate of Beijing Women's Teachers School. Kong xiangmian Lingren's great-grandfather was the first supervisor of Beijing Normal University (the predecessor of Peking University), and was the first supervisor of the Qing Dynasty College. Kong xiangmian Lingren's grandmother, Lloyd, taught Phonology and Hook Stock Science (Geometry), at Beijing Women's Normal School, and published a mathematical monograph 'Hook shares and prescriptions', is the earliest generation of female teachers in China. The enlightenment of a family environment can often determine a person's career for life. Although Kong xiangmian Lingren later held many important positions in society and frequently appeared on various important occasions as a prominent social activist, she always called herself 'an ordinary teacher.' 
As a teenager, Kong xiangmian Lingren studied in Qufu, Nanjing, Shanghai and other places with the migration of his parents. After the outbreak of the war of resistance, she came to Chongqing during the war, and admitted to the best secondary school in the country at that time-Shaping Nankai High School. In this campus where the famous educator Mr. Zhang Boling for the avoidance of the sun, and will advance the education reserve essence from Tianjin to this campus, Kong xiangmian Lingren enrolled in school listening to the 'allow to allow, change' Nankai training, undergo strict and orderly management, smoked with rigorous and conscious and listened to the speech of Chinese Communist Party leader Zhou Enlai. In 1942, she was admitted to the Southwest General Assembly Department of History. Like many aspiring young people, she is committed to the divine cause of fighting and rescue with a full patriotic passion, learning cultural knowledge with hunger and thirst. She is in a short and shabby bungalow, topped with a tin roof, facing the mud wall, in the Ham can sit on a simple desks, accompanied by the sometimes hit sound of wind and rain alarm, painstakingly read, laid a solid foundation for future academic success. At that time, the spring city of Kunming was a major cultural town behind the big back, known as the 'fortress of democracy'. 'I chose 'Poems' which I taught more than one, Shen Congwen's 'History of Chinese Novels', Zhu Ziqing, 'History of Chinese Literature' by Wu Han by Wu Han, 'History of Qin Han' by Lei Haizong, Zheng Tianting's 'History of Ming Qing', Shao Xunzheng's 'Modern History of China', Feng 'History of Chinese Philosophy' taught by Yolan, the knowledge and training gained from these masters have made my life inexhaustible. ' Half a century later, Kong xiangmian Lingren remains deeply forgettable about this. More importantly, the noble practice of smelling more than one, Zhu Ziqing, Wu Han and other democratic fighters that 'rich cannot be good, poor cannot move, and mighty can not be subdued' took root in her heart. 
After the victory of the resistance, the Southwest United University, composed of Tsinghua, Peking University and Nankai, respectively, relocated, Kong xiangmian Lingren in Tsinghua Yuan division Yu Daisun, Yao Congwu, Ka Bangfu and other famous scholars. In 1947, she completed her studies and went to society, but in the years of devastation and war, Kong xiangmian Lingren, who graduated from Tsinghua, was also difficult to find a suitable job. He had to temporarily work as a small staff member at a bank in Qingdao. 
After the founding of the new China, Kong xiangmian Lingren of Fenghua Zhengmao once again raised the ideal sail. In the country's boom to study the 'Big Brother' of the Soviet Union, she entered the Russian course at Shandong University. Asked whether her ideal at the time was intended to be a Russian professor, she laughed and replied: 'No, I wanted to be a journalist.' Cheerful character, perseverance, keen intriguing, funny language, fluent writing are indeed the inherent advantages she has to become a journalist. In 1985, Kong xiangmian Lingren with the feature film 'Confucius Birthplace Line' in the United States, she carried out natural smooth dubbing, explain, received a good effect. Indeed, within her blood relatives, there is also a shortage of reporters worldwide. Her eldest sister Kong xiangmian Ling, who has long served as a senior program presenter for Voice of America, and US President Ford, Reagan, Carter, Bush, Clinton, Secretary of State Kissinger and other world figures, have maintained extraordinary contacts. She also visited China to interview Conk Ching and Chen Muhua. and other state leaders. Kong xiangmian Linghe's daughter (Kong xiangmian Lingren's nephew), Dong Kai-Ti is the famous ABC New York TV prime time news program presenter, hailed as one of the 'three Chinese gold flowers among American television broadcasters'. He has been named several times as the best journalist in the United States and won the 'Outstanding Elite Award', Mulo Memorial Award, 'Best Live Reporting Award', etc. were selected together with Li Zhengdao, Yang Zhenning, Wang An and others Chinese American character, was named one of eleven prominent Chinese American celebrities in 1986. 'Many Chinese Americans cheered loudly because of Dong Kai-ti's achievements: 'Once again, the Chinese nation is a great nation,' Hong Kong xiangmian's weekly report said. His achievements in the United States are no lower than the white people. '' This was reproduced in the 'Reference News' from the mainland. 
However, under the arrangement of the God of Fate, Kong xiangmian Lingren was neither a professor of Russian nor a journalist. 
When Kong xiangmian Lingren is about to complete the Russian language course, the Department of Foreign Languages of Shandong University requested her to teach her in foreign languages in advance. How could the Department of History easily release this senior student at the Southwest General Assembly? Opinions between the two sides cannot be disputed, and finally by the principal Huagang, a hammer: 'The Russian language is a tool for governance, or let her go to the Department of History!' Since then, Kong xiangmian Lingren said goodbye to his journalist dream, left the Russian language profession and stepped into a rigorous and realistic history teaching and research center. This has been for more than 40 years. To this day, in a situation where basic subjects of history and other basic disciplines have been socially destitute, Kong xiangmian Lingren is still unregrettable and happy with his original career choice. As a teacher, Kong xiangmian Lingren taught dozens of students, can be called Tao Li full world. 'Three thousand disciples, seventy Sage', which was the teaching of her ancestor Confucius. For more than 40 years, Kong xiangmian Lingren takes the example of his ancestors, and has cultivated a large number of useful talents for the cause of the construction of the motherland, most of them have emerged in all walks of life. As a hard-working gardener, carefully pampering the seedlings of the future, if the Confucius god knows, will also be pleased to his descendants dedicated to the ordinary and great cause of teachers. She has lectured on topics such as modern Chinese history, modern Chinese economic history and modern Chinese economic history. In recent years, we have focused mainly on training graduate students, teachers and mentoring foreign exchange scholars and international students. Her lectures are lively, guided by good, thought-oriented, scientific and fun combined, popular among students. 
Economic change is the foundation of social change. To understand the dynamics of an era, it is necessary to understand the economic conditions of that era. As early as the founding of the country, the history of Taidou Yan Zhongping wrote about how to deepen the study of China's recent modern history, he said with concern: 'In the field of research of nearly 100 years of history, the field of economic history is in a relatively backward state,' which will have negative consequences. To that end, the scholar called for strengthening the study of China's recent and modern economic history. Kong xiangmian Lingren feels very much about this. From the day on the podium, he dedicated his talents and energy to the recently opened garden of China's modern economic history. Compared to other specialized history, teaching and research on economic history requires a lot of information and accurate data, as well as a strong theoretical thinking ability. Boring and esoteric China's recent and modern economic history has discouraged many young students and cast their doors on another side. Kong xiangmian Lingren has attracted students from one year to another with his rich knowledge, interesting language, deep out of the way of teaching. Many students said: 'Teacher Kong xiangmian's penture makes us listen to what would have felt boring and tedious economic history course, actually felt like a pleasure.' Under the strong infection, some students came under her door to engage in teaching and research on China's recent economic history as a pleasure. 
Rigorous learning style, persistent pursuit, Kong xiangmian Lingren has achieved remarkable academic achievements. In the early 1960s, she published 'Several Issues on the Original Accumulation of Capital in China', a profound, unique discussion and attention to academia. Written in the early 80s, such as 'On the Ocean Movement' and others, dared to break through some of the exclusion areas of past research and put forward many new ideas on some extremely sensitive issues, accepted by many scholars, thus promoting the study of the history of the ocean movement. The article 'Socio-economic and Boxer Movement in Shandong at the end of the nineteenth century' discussed the social background, nature and role of the Boxer movement, and received the attention of Chinese and foreign experts at the International Symposium on the History of Boxer Movement held in 1980. The novel point of view, unique perspective, comprehensive discussion, has been worth over a decade. The article 'The Night' and China's Economy around 1930, was considered by peer experts as 'a good economic history paper and a very good literary book.' In response, Mr. Mao Dun, author of the novel, had written to confirm it. In her article 'Confucius and Sun Yat-sen,' she pointed out that Confucius and Sun Yat-sen were two peaks in the history of Chinese thought before modern times. This view was reproduced by many newspapers at home and abroad, with a strong response. In addition, she has written several papers on 'There are two kinds of anti-imperialist anti-feudal struggles in modern Chinese history', 'An Exposition of Shandong Machine Bureau', 'The Positive Significance of Confucianism to China's Modernization Construction', and participated in the editorial work of books such as 'Selected Materials for the Boxer Investigation' and 'Confucian Archive Selection' 
Entering the nineties, Kong xiangmian Lingren has achieved more fruitful academic results. In June 1991, her editor-in-chief of nearly one million words, 'Pioneers of Modern Chinese Enterprises' (top and next two volumes), attracted widespread attention from academia. The book selected 110 articles written by many scholars and scholars, involving a representative modern enterprise pioneer up to 120 people, both comprehensive and accurate description of people and scientific in-depth analysis, both objective and fair evaluation and pioneering research, providing readers with a flesh, full An informative history of letters. Moreover, the book, while elaborating on the difficult journey of modern enterprise pioneers and promoting their entrepreneurial spirit, also summarizes a set of valuable management experience left by them in long-term business activities, thus providing a certain historical reference for the country's current economic construction. After studying the book, a group of famous scholars have sent letters to Kong xiangmian Lingren, expressing deep respect for her keen gaze and scientific attitude, after five years, paintings and co-ordination, to complete the project. Half a year later, her editor-in-chief's book 'China Modernization and the Movement of Foreign Affairs' was launched. Based on the rich results of research on the ocean affairs movement in recent years, the book has opened up many new areas and expands new thinking on major issues such as China's early modernization and current reform and opening up. 
In the face of many results, some good people think that the old hole lingren pen recuperation. This series includes more than 1,500 long-established Chinese enterprises founded before 1949, including industry, commerce, catering, service, medicine, finance, transportation and cultural and entertainment industries, covering the vast majority of prefecture-level cities and some townships. The book describes the difficult and difficult entrepreneurial history of long-established enterprises, unique business strategies, obvious competitive tips, famous products, not only objectively demonstrates the traditional advantages and pioneering spirit of these enterprises, but also fully affirms their new development and new development since the reform and opening up Contribution, not only excavated many little-known historical materials, enriched the content of China's modern economy, but also summed up Many successful experiences and failures have played the role of promoting the old and serving the new era. This huge project has received the attention of CPPCC Vice Chairmen Gu Mu, Qian Weichang, Su Buqing, Sun Fuling, Wanguoquan, Ma Wanqi, Vice Chairmen of the National People's Congress Chen Muhua, Fei Xiaotong, Lei Jie-Qiong, Wang Guangying and others. They either served as general advisers to the series of books, or gladly poured black inscription. This set of research, information in one, authoritative and permanent history, is now in the end stage, is about to meet with readers. 
Science is borderless. Kong xiangmian Lingren's academic achievements have long been famous, and overseas research institutions and famous scholars have invited her to lecture. In April 1985, Kong xiangmian Lingren, as a renowned scholar, embarked on the territory of the United States. Under the arrangements of the US-China Academic Exchange Committee, she visited 11 famous cities, including San Francisco, Los Angeles, Washington and New York. For 110 days in the United States, she had academic exchanges with a large number of world-renowned American Sinologists. At the University of Oregon, she exchanged views with Professor Josephw Eesheriek on the relationship between socioeconomics and the Revolution; at the University of Washington in Seattle, she talked about the ocean movement with her peers including Professor Elizabeth ethperry; and at the University of California, Los Angeles, She and Chinese scholar Prof Zongzhi Huang focused on the aftermath of the Opium War Economic changes in various regions in Shandong; at the University of Michigan, she shared views with Professor AlbertFeuerker on issues such as the industrialization of China in the nineteenth century and the use of Ming Qing archives; and at the University of Pittsburgh she worked with Professor Irwinj Schulman The origin and other problems... learn Confucius quote 'Have friends from afar The American Sinologist and some students from various countries who are interested in traditional Chinese culture, learned that she is the 76th generation of Confucius. Naturally, she would not miss the opportunity to explain Confucius and Confucianism. A South Korean student asked: 'Does China offer Confucianism classes? What is the idea to educate children and students?' A Singaporean female graduate student asked: 'Is there any relationship between the low social status of women in China and Confucius's view that only women and villains are difficult to feed?' Taiwanese students asked: 'Does the mainland print Confucius's book? Is it printed 'Theory'?' ... To this, Kong xiangmian Lingren all responded to their satisfaction. That's how, all the way, all the way, everywhere, echoed applause, she won a reputation for the motherland. She also travelled to Japan, Singapore, the Soviet Union and Hong Kong xiangmian and Macao for academic exchanges. For such a famous scholar, MarQULS in the United States and the World List of People published by the University of Cambridge have long included her name and achievements. In the face of honors, she always said with humility: 'My achievements and honors are not my own. Belonging to every Chinese woman, belongs to all Chinese people.' In 1969, all the arts of Shandong University where Kong xiangmian Lingren is located was relocated to Qufu, merged with Qufu Normal University. This time she lived and worked in her hometown for five years. It was the first time she spent so long in her hometown. Here she looks deeply at her hometown, thinking deeply about her ancestors, while in a particular environment she carries the burden and suffering of many outsiders unimaginable. Qufu at that time was the base of the villain 'transformation of three holes' (Kong xiangmianfu, Confucius Temple, Kong xiangmian Lin). One day, a representative of the army gave instructions to her: 'Kong xiangmian Lingren, you are the descendant of Confucius. We value you very much, let you personally 'transform the three holes', hope you will seriously build your ancestor's counter!' Kong xiangmian Lingren was painfully faced with such a tragic era of trampling on culture, and a miraculous car accident helped her solve the siege. In a few days, when she was struggling to ride through the ancient gate cave in Qufu, a large truck full of grain grains rolled her to the ground, leaving her unconscious, and the bike had long been shattered. It was unfortunate that a few tons of big trucks rolled over her left thigh and inside her arms, causing only part of the muscle to stick to her bones; the accident forced her to lie in the hospital bed for half a year, and the army representatives had to make her 'three-hole' plan to 'transform three holes'. 
After his illness was healed, Kong xiangmian Lingren was arranged to teach students of industrial and peasant college students on 'Modern Chinese History'. At that time, she was carrying two children alone, both to perform daily teaching and labor tasks and to take care of all household chores. Her parents passed away in the 'anti-right' and 'Cultural Revolution', and by Kong xiangmian Lingren and others quietly buried their ashes in Kong xiangmian Lin, where his predecessors long slept. Her seven brothers and sisters, in addition to the big sister Kong xiangmian Ling and far on the other side of the ocean, the pseudonym 'Xiao Huan' presided over the 'VOA' literary theme. The rest are suffering times in various parts of the continent. Her husband, which was far from a thousand miles away from Qingdao, was beaten as early as possible into the right, and the Cultural Revolution storm that swept the earth made him escape again. This deeply affectionate couple is far away, the clouds block, the two places separated for 20 years, in order to visit Fujun, Kong xiangmian Lingren with two children on the Jiaoji line to travel at least 100 times. 
Political discrimination, spiritual depression, Lawton in life, the hardships of the years did not make Kong xiangmian lingren depressed, she believes: the cloud will finally pass, and history will finally be its own face. It is with this firm belief that she silently cultivates her beloved educational grounds and silently endured the tribulations caused by society. 
That tragic era has passed away. The earth is recovering, spring has arrived. 
In 1978, her husband transferred from Qingdao to the Department of Economics of Shandong University. Twenty years of cowboy weaving woman's life is over, and both of them cherish the good time that should have come earlier than the wings. During the day, they were busy on the podium, and in the evening they walked side by side on campus. At the end of 1994 the first 'National Ten Sapphire Wedding Couples' selection, this pair of loving couples was among them. In line with the beauty of family life, unwittingly, Kong xiangmian Lingren's social responsibility on his shoulder has increased. In 1983, she was elected Vice Chairman of the Shandong CPPCC. To date, she is Shandong's only three consecutive vice-chairman of the CPPCC. After that, she was elected vice-president of Confucius Foundation, vice-chairman of the NLD Central Committee, Standing Committee of the CPPCC and vice president of the All-China Women's Federation. As social status increases, her sense of social responsibility has increased. 
Since entering the CPPCC, Kong xiangmian Lingren has maintained the character of the people's teachers. Back in April 1983 at the first session of the fifth session of the Shandong Provincial Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference (CPPCC), she made proposals on the reform of university education: 'First, break the system of ownership of the talent unit and introduce talent mobility in order to realize the full potential of talents. Second, the student's knowledge is too narrow. Arts students should take one or two natural sciences; science and engineering students should take one or two social sciences. It is desirable that all universities offer courses on modern Chinese history to strengthen patriotism education and enrich students' historical knowledge. Third, change the distribution system, which is now entirely State-wrapped, and mobilizes the consciousness of students' learning. Fourth, do not set up universities into a small society, all-encompassing. Big and complete, small and none adapted to the needs of modern construction.' The Popular Daily publishes her forward thinking in a prominent position. At many important conferences, she called on many occasions to raise the fundamental importance of education, increase investment in education, improve the working and living environment of teachers, and to select and re-use young teachers for the development of cross-century talents. It was gratifying to note that her recommendations had been taken into account by the relevant departments and had been gradually implemented and improved in practice. She herself taught her postgraduate students and undergraduates in personality, carefully trained in her studies, and provided a mother-like care and care in life. 
As a friend of the Communist Party, democratic parties play an irreplaceable role in discussing national events and participating in political affairs. Elected NLD Central Vice-President shortly. Kong xiangmian Lingren spoke on the multi-party cooperation system led by the Communist Party of China on the theme of 'mutual sincerity, Tancheng meet' and expressed his sincere support for the sixteenth word policy advocated by the Communist Party of 'long-term coexistence, mutual supervision, good care, honor and affront to the Communist Party'. In the process of participating in state affairs, the sense of responsibility and mission of CPPCC members encouraged her to speak for the people, share concerns and give advice to the nation. For more than a decade, she has always adjusted the schedule of teaching and research, making every effort to squeeze out time to attend consultative meetings, take part in field visits, learn about the actual situation, and put forward many relevant and constructive ideas and proposals by writing articles, writing proposals, making statements, talking about ideas and other ways. The vast majority of them are adopted at all levels of decision-making. In previous years, as leaders in individual localities attached great importance to democratic political construction, she had frankly embraced 'not to say nothing, say nothing'. Later, on the basis of her proposals, she had mostly responded positively to the reality, and made a statement in good faith at the CPPCC meeting. The People's Daily and other newspapers have published her opinions, and have had a strong reaction among the readers, especially among members of the CPPCC at all levels. More recently, she also discussed political participation at the Standing Committee of the National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference (CPPCC), centered around mastering theory Understand the actual, master the principles and other aspects. Some constructive proposals were put forward and published in the People's Political Consultative Conference (CPPCC). Her proposal for the establishment of the Confucius Culture Institute was adopted, and the central and local departments allocated funds to create it. 
As a knowledgeable woman, Kong xiangmian Lingren, after assuming the leadership of the All-China Women's Federation, feels that there is still a lot of in-depth work to be done in order to achieve the true emancipation of women. To that end, she drafted a speech at the Second Session of the Eighth Session of the National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference (CPPCC), on 'Emphasis on the Selection and Use of Women Cadres', which was unanimously commended. In her view, to build socialism with Chinese characteristics, women's participation in politics is the big trend; for the country, government and society, it is first to raise people's ideological awareness and further eliminate old ideas that men are inferior; for women, they should be self-esteem, self-esteem, self-reliance, self-reliance and self-improvement.
