eported her views. 
In October 1994, she led a Chinese women's delegation to Poland and Bulgaria. During the visit, the delegation was accommodated in the State Guest House and received a high degree of courtesy. They exchanged views and information with the deputy presidents of the two countries on bilateral economic cooperation, trade exchanges, the situation of women in both countries and their preparations for the Fourth World Conference on Women. As head of the delegation, she received high praise for her vast knowledge, insightful insights and decent behavior. National television stations in the two countries reported their whereabouts continuously. At the UN Fourth World Conference on Women held in September 1995, she wrote a statement for the NGO Forum of the General Assembly on 'The Great Contribution of Chinese Women', which showed the good style of Chinese women from different sides and helped to enhance mutual understanding. The Chinese Organizing Committee of the World Women's Association issued a 'Certificate of Recognition' to her as a result of 'making significant achievements'.

memoirs.memoirContent:
ã€Attached 1ã€‘Kong zhao Zhao/Zhu Huarong/Huang Shouli: 'Legislative work is dead, judicial work mess, town anti-movement killed more, legal education move dogma'
Original editor's note: This is a small right-wing group headed by Kong zhao Zhao, Department of Criminal Law, Renmin University of China. On weekdays, they spread a lot of reactionary fallacy. This time again, taking the opportunity of the Party, systematically and viciously launched a comprehensive attack against the party, and the democratic rule of law of the people was a focus of their attack. This article is a slightly abridged by the book's editors, compiled by the classroom based on their speeches. 
(i), Legislative aspects
1. Lack of legislation
Kong zhao Zhao said, 'It was difficult for us to do a complete set of things in the early days of the founding of the country, but it has been more than three years since the constitution was enacted, and the legislative work has been stalled. He added that these laws, such as the people and the criminal laws, which concern the fundamental interests of the people, began to draft the Penal Code in 1953, have not been prepared for four years. 'We should weigh the interests, have great legal interests, or no legal damage.' 
2. can not be relied upon
Kong zhao Zhao said, 'We can't rely on it now. It's hard to wonder that the judges are very heavy,' he said. Huang Shouli also believes that 'Peng Zhen said that the trial work is 'based on facts, the law is the normal', and we have no law, and this is empty words. Now, except the Constitution, there is no criminal, civil code, criminal code or civil procedure code.' 
3. Lack of central importance to legislative work
Huang Shouli said that 'the central government attaches great importance to the rule of law, and in fact, very little attention is paid to it. Attention is given to the campaign and less attention to the regular rule of law work. Criminal legislation work is discouraged.' He said that legislation was so slow and related to several guiding ideas at the central level. First of all, 'the Central Government believes that there is no law that can act in accordance with policy. 'This is correct in the early days of liberation, but it is not enough to pay attention to the law,' he said. Secondly, 'the Central Committee is afraid to enact early laws to restrain their hands and feet. In fact, it is necessary to restrain cadres by law to prevent them from breaking the law. There is a law that restricts arbitrariness. Therefore, the central government fears that the law is inherently contrary to the rule of law,' he said. In addition, he said: 'Some work in the Party Central Committee has replaced legislative work. For example, the ten-member group of the Communist Party of China (CPC), has proposed a standard for dealing with the counter-revolution, and the courts use it as a basis for judgment, but this work should be made public by the NPC Standing Committee and should not be limited to internal control. Zhu Huarong believes that 'the central government attaches great importance to the rule of law is not enough. Judging from the overall legal situation, it is quite lagging behind the real needs.' He said: 'From the trial, everyone has felt the need for law since the examination of the wrong case. The reason for this is the lack of attention given to the legal work and the failure to push this work forward,' he said. 
4. Guiding principles of legislation
Kong zhao Zhao said: 'Most of the provisions of our draft penal code are a replica of the KMT law. They are not summed up from reality at all, and the legislative work is greatly lagging behind the development of reality.' 'Our legislative work does not necessarily come from the summary, some have not been elevated to law, and it is correct to summarize the experience of the masses in the campaign to legislate, but some crimes, such as homicide and theft, will be difficult to generate in the big movement, and expand these local experiences, this is insufficient legislation. Excuses before. The crime of adultery has been summed up for years, but has never met the masses in legal form.' 
'Some people believe that law can only be produced in movement is limited and cannot be extended to the whole legislature,' Zhu said. Some argue that it is not realistic that laws follow reality and that they can only be enacted if experience is mature. The law should come ahead of reality and guide practice, as was the Constitution. Legislation should be foreseeable, such as lessons learned, many things are dealt with without law, and experience has matured legislation, and things no longer exist. Some people believe that once the law provides, even if things are settled, the situation will develop away from the actual reality and restrain the hands and feet of the masses. This view is one-sided, they do not understand that laws can be amended at any time. In fact, due to the absence of laws, many mistakes have occurred, and in order to better combat crime, the timely enactment of the law will have a good effect.' 
5. Contradictory legislation
Huang Shouli said: 'China's single-line regulations are not uniform. Each department makes a single line of regulations each other, and they play each other's mouth, lack of uniform codification and audit.' It was also stated that 'some laws were outdated and not amended in time. Such as the Marriage Act XIX.' 
6. Directions of the central heads on legislative work
Huang Shouli said: 'Dong Lao quoted Tang Law as an example that has been published for decades to shirk our responsibility for legislative delays. However, he did not know that he had used Sui Law before the announcement of Tang Law. After the victory of the revolution, the Soviet Union also allowed the use of some old laws, it is clear that they are all legally based, so we can no longer postpone legislation.' 
(ii), Judicial aspects
1. Low level of judicial cadre and weak views on the rule of law
Kong zhao said: 'Judges' current thoughts are contradictory. On the one hand, they urgently demand the law, which is good for their own case. On the other hand, there is also fear of having laws, because there are laws that cannot be arbitrary and are not very accustomed.' 'It can be seen from the comments made by the actual departments on the sentence of the draft penal code, many demand to increase the sentence, too much flexibility in legal requirements, is also a manifestation of the weak idea of the rule of law. There are laws that mainly bind the members of the judiciary and will not bind the masses.' 
Huang said: 'The country is poorly equipped with judicial cadres. It is said that county court presidents are limited to level 16, and then moved away again. This makes people feel that the lower courts are unsupported. Many of the judges will not even write their judgments. And do not think it is a drawback, anti-above pride.' 'Capitalist countries have high demands on judicial personnel. Judges in the Kuomintang grass-roots courts are almost all university graduates, but we do not have a few college graduates. In order to improve the quality of judges and prosecutors, we should be university graduates, and we are 'upside down', who graduates from Shanghai Law College as adjudicators, and university law graduates are clerks.' 
Zhu said, 'Judiciary cadres have heard that Chairman Mao said that judicial work should be the work of experts. In fact, it is not an expert. It will not even write judgments. It's only that political conditions are good, have good ingredients, and have some experience in struggles. These alone cannot be in the interests of the people.' He therefore suggested that 'it is necessary to raise the level of cadres. The training of cadres should be planned, the law department can carry out this task, and the judiciary should be trained to improve their operations on a rotating basis.' 
Kong zhao said: 'The level of judicial cadre is very low. Graduation of students should enrich the grassroots in large numbers. Some have experience, some have no experience, exercise for a year and a half load will also be higher than the current level of judicial cadres. Graduates in the future should enrich the grassroots, which can avoid mistakes.' 
2. There are many mistakes and trials mess
Huang said: 'There are many wrong cases, not 1--2%, but 10-20%, making people break down their homes, this is an intolerable phenomenon.' He also said, 'A large number of people who have been sentenced to a few years' imprisonment without reaching his hand into the pockets of others; cadres who violate the law and discipline, combat revenge and force death have reviewed the matter.' 
Zhu said, 'It is not right that someone is satisfied with more than 90% of the correct cases and ignore the number of wrong cases. A wrong case is 100 per cent error for the parties. The evaluation of the trial work cannot be calculated from the average number of cases'. 'Chengdu prisons are in a lot of people, they cannot be delegated, and they are full in a few days.' 
3. blame the central
'Lu Mingjian said not to think of the law as a universal thing. This is actually not the law,' Kong zhao said. Lu Mingjian gave an example of the unilateral emphasis on the outcome of the law, which prevented many judicial staff from prosecuting crimes. I don't think it's a result of doing it in accordance with the law, but an unjustifiable result.' 'We have a different understanding of 'emphasizing the rule of law, and not letting the law restraint in their hands'. Some people believe that the law is in their own favour, otherwise it can go beyond the legal circle, which is actually synonymous with the destruction of the law.' 
'The Central Committee often mentioned that we have no experience, so mistakes are inevitable,' Huang said. This is true to some extent, but it is an unforgivable mistake to apply to the administration of justice. The administration of justice should require 100 per cent correctness, and mistakes can lead to the death of a family. Under the guidance of this kind of thought, the cadres below produced the idea of 'rather not right'. This should be blamed for the Central Committee.' 
(iii), Law's monotheistic work and education work
Huang said: 'The goals and specifications of the law department are not clear. They have graduated eight years, but how many people are engaged in judicial work? Some are involved in administrative work, some have backlogs in schools and very little decentralized.' 'Cultivating law students have dogmatic problems and hard moving Soviet experience. Some waste classmates, such as curriculum settings. The stagnation of the scientific research work of the Faculty of Law and the delay in the establishment of the Institute of Law is inseparable from the lack of attention paid by the central government to this work.' Insufficient legal ideology education is also an important issue. Some believe that as long as party discipline is respected, it is not important to comply with the law. In fact, there is a 'gaogan' thing.' 
Zhu said: 'Legal scientific research efforts emphasize contact with reality, but many materials that should not be kept confidential are kept confidential. The United States publishes crime figures every year, and we believe it is partially correct. Bourgeois states dare to expose, why do we not dare to publish crime figures? Of course this may be used by the bourgeois state for counter-propaganda. Is it not afraid of our anti-propaganda? 'We do not dare criminal figures, and this is a violation of the communist declaration, because Marx said that it is a shame for the Communist Party to conceal its policies.' 
(iv), Town Counterwork
1. town anti-killing too much
Huang said: 'Town has killed 770,000 people too many people. It has not killed so many people in history, and there are mistakes. For example, at the time of land reform, some had killed a prime minister who had no evil in order to launch the masses. If Chairman Mao proposed a 'stabbing' system early, he could kill many fewer people. Of course, you (refer to the party), to kill 1 million can also be done, whatever you say, pending future history conclusions.' 
Zhu said: 'The town is killing like a lot of people. Corpses are everywhere in the prison. After burying their hair, they accidentally set foot.' 
2. for Hu Feng shouting 'wrong'
Huang said that Hu Feng's literary route of the opposition party says he is counter-revolutionary. However, according to the 'three batches of materials' it is impossible to identify him as counter-revolutionary. As for his 300,000 words, the Opinion is directed against Zhou Yang, so only if you can prove that Zhou Yang is not mistaken, Hu Feng can explain that Hu Feng was wrong.' 'If Hu Feng is a counter-revolution, why is it still not judged? Don't dare see people yet? Is he investigating his connection with Chiang Kai-shek?' 
(v), In criminal law science
1. Criminal law does not use class
'Class is spoken everywhere, too vulgar,' Kong zhao said. 'Class talk, empty, do not solve specific problems.' It was also stated that: 'In the context of the sub-rules of criminal law, the significance of combating crime should be as little as possible and more about the composition of the crime.' 
2. Soviet criminal law science nothing, old criminal law science is good
Huang said: 'All things in the Soviet Union were copied from the old laws, some in the Soviet Union and the old laws. The old law, the Soviet Union did not necessarily have.' He also said: 'The Soviet Penal Code gives me positions and opinions, and the old law gives me independent thinking.'

People's University sectarianism is the most serious. In the past, there were two factions of the National People's Congress, including Yang Huanan, Hu Xikui, and the Chinese University, the former were guerrilla, and the latter were mostly intellectuals. 
Some people say that Peking University and other schools like organs, I say that my school like military barracks, have an order on the upper side, follow it down, do not move the brain, there is no little academic discussion style, far worse than Peking University, and schools often take much pride in party members. This article is an interview with Han guanqing Kaili. Han guanqing Kaili, born in 1945, Professor, School of Economics and Management, Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications, Ph.D. Former Manager of Strategic Technology Evaluation Department of US-Pacific Bell, Special Adviser to China Satellite Communications Corporation; Deputy Director of the Economic and Technological Development Research Center of the Ministry of Posts and Telecommunications; Adviser on Telecommunication Policy and Development Strategy at the World Bank; member of the Advisory Committee of Experts on the Drafting of Telecommunications Law, known as 'Cannons in the Telecommunications Industry'. 
His father, Han guanqing Guanqing, left the United States of America in 1950 to return to a poor and backward China. He published 'I am there there' in the US newspaper. The subtitle is 'Why I want to return to China'. After returning home, the Beijing Institute for Tuberculosis Prevention and Control was established with the support of relevant parties and served as director. In 1957, because of the logic that you have bourgeoisie education, you must be reactionary, and you cannot love the party to love the people; and you returned to China precisely on the eve of the war against US aid to North Korea, so it is probably an American agent-and formed into the right. 
Han guanqing Kaili is his father's good son, is the second generation of the right. 
GLOBAL Outlook: We know that you have educational experience at the best universities at home and abroad. First, we would like to ask you to talk about your personal education experience and how these experiences affect you personally. 
KAN KALI: It is true that I have been studying at the best schools in China, not only after studying in Tsinghua, but I went to Stanford University in the United States. From the beginning of elementary school, I studied the Beijing Experimental Second Elementary School, the secondary school was Beijing IV secondary school in six years. In 1964, the radio department of Tsinghua University was admitted to the radio department of Tsinghua University in 1964. 
Our schools at that time, especially primary and secondary schools, did nurture students' desire for truth, and I think that was the core value of quality education. Now, school education is too successful. Why is it going to primary school? In order to take a better secondary school, why is it? In order to get to a good university, for what? For future studies, then go out to find a job that earns more money, or a job of iron rice bowl. This learning goal, which is extremely harmful in itself, is to turn learning into a means of achieving merit. The burden of schooling also burdens students tired, natural desire for knowledge and fun of learning are fundamentally destroyed, and the core of education is broken. 
Children are born with a desire for curiosity and knowledge about the world, and learning will not be a burden in itself, but a pleasure as long as they are good at guiding. Learned something new every day, previously did not understand, this itself is a great sense of achievement. Even sometimes, things in class do not quench thirst, but naturally go to the library, or go online for further answers. At that time, we often had to do some small experiments at home, like a biology class, raise a few silkworm in our own home, or observe ants in the yard; for physics classes, learn the principle of convex lenses, take a magnifying glass, focus under the sun, put the paper out; learn materialism and idealism, too. Why is mentalism wrong to think independently on your own? Through reading, debate, and independent thinking, you can reach a conclusion by thinking through the end. I think these are the most valuable educational experiences. 
Later, I went to Tsinghua, which was a six-year program. In 1966, I did not finish my second year, I had the Cultural Revolution. In 1978, I resumed the recruitment of postgraduate students, I took the Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications. As a result, I became the first group of public overseas students after the reform and opening up. After the establishment of diplomatic relations between China and the United States in 1979, I went to Stanford to read communications technology. 
More than 30 years have passed, and the courses that Stanford taught me almost forgot, but left the foundation of telecommunication technology. And then I did telecommunication policy research, at least technically nobody could afford me. But what's more important is Stanford's spiritual culture. 
In recent years, I told students at school, what has Stanford left me? Something in the classroom was almost forgotten, but there was something that melted into the blood. One of the most important things I learned at Stanford is that 'Economic efficiency is the only criterion for testing technology.' 
As we all know, Stanford University is known as the Alma Mater of Silicon Valley. According to the data, 780 percent of executives of companies large and small in Silicon Valley, especially the founders and CEOs, have graduated from Stanford. Even companies like Google and Yahoo!, founders went out to start a business without graduating from Stanford, turning technology into real productivity and socioeconomic benefits. 
I was an international student, so from the first day I went abroad, I thought about what to do to return to China. At that time, because we were the first group of overseas students, the Ministry of Education did not know anything about the outside world, and there was no restriction on what we could go out and learn anything. I think that a country as large as China, at that time, only millions of telephones were available across the country. In some places, one unit did not necessarily have a phone call, let alone individuals have a phone at home. And the kind of popularity of telephone calls abroad makes me feel that China has a huge space for development in this area, so I chose to learn telecommunications. So, I think learning serves the needs of society. Later, I switched to regulation in telecommunications and to research on telecommunication policy and reform of telecommunications institutions, serving this social need. To say a big point, such learning is a sense of social responsibility and adaptation to the needs of the development of the times. 
Now I'm teaching in school, so I know more about what the current students think. Now students are not considering social needs, but what industry makes more money or has iron rice bowls. This is about learning from the point of view of individual utilisation rather than truly understanding and meeting the needs of society, which also leads them to a particularly dying learning, particularly narrower knowledge, and simply unable to adapt to changing social circumstances. 
GLOBAL Outlook: The common problem of Chinese students today must also be a problem of the education system. What do you think there are systemic problems with education in China? 
KAN Kaili: I moved from the Telecom Institute to Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications in 2000 to become the first dean of the School of Economics and Management. After taking office, we had a very big debate about who was at school for whom? Is the teacher serving the student, or is the student serving the teacher? In view of the prevailing situation in Chinese universities now, not only do students serve teachers, but even if they think of graduate students, they are still working for teachers! 
The professor gets the project, earns money into his pockets, and then assigns the tasks, and lets students do projects for themselves. Some professors start their own company, graduate students go to the professor's company to work, and even punch the card. Some professors did not get their own projects and did not work companies, so what to do? Let the students go to the company part-time and 'rent' the students. The company gave four to five thousand professors a month, and the students only got 4500, and turned into a bag worker. 
Obviously, these teachers are earning student money, and no wonder many graduate students call their professors 'bosses' behind them. These phenomena were unheard of in China's pre-1949 universities, even before the 1980s. The corruption of this society, the corruption of academics and the corruption of universities is simply a mess, and should it be justified! 
Not to say that students can't earn money from working outside their studies, but to say that students make money to professors, which is absolutely illegal in the West and is unjustifiable. But it has become a common phenomenon in our country, and even the Ministry of Education has made regulations that each professor bring postgraduate students to pay money to the school. What is the reason for that? Because students make money for professors, a portion of the money that professors earn from their students are handed over to the school-this is what the Ministry of Education requires to bring a graduate student to pay thousands of dollars a year. 
Isn't this kind of Ministry of Education regulation that Hesen prescribes the 'clean silver'? The corrupt officials and officials raided the people in the local area. Not only can the dynasty be able to control, but also to give it to a part of the court. This means that if you do not go to become corrupt officials, you can't afford to pay the bad silver for the peninsula, it is really a mustache logic. 
Before 1949, our old Tsinghua, Old Peking University, or Southwest General Assembly, the relationship between professors and students was really sympathetic to his father and son. Teachers are looking forward to the achievement of students, and when they encounter particularly poor students, professors will pay their own salaries to subsidize the students. That was really a well-nurtured, but now a naked monetary interest. Or, a student worked here for a few years at the professor and made enough money for the professor before you graduate, this is an official legal selling education. 
Of course, there are many illegal selling educational qualifications. How many 'working PhD' is there in China? Many are state-owned veterans and executives. It doesn't matter if the owner of a private enterprise should be educated, but people in the system are not OK, promotion depends on your education. There are a few senior officials who are not PhDs, but you see how many of them have come to class? 
How did their PhD come? It's all bought with money, but also with the money of the state. In the name of state-owned enterprises or government departments, they gave professors a few hundred thousand or millions of projects. It doesn't matter if they can't do it. This is hard work! Professor Qian Qian, get some invoices and get reimbursed. In this way, the professor asks other students to take classes, exams, write papers, or simply 'outsource' them out. Now there is a special industrial chain, which is to write papers. The price is not expensive, a few thousand yuan a copy, and a reputation guarantee, not through not charging money. The United States only gave 30,000 PhDs a year, and China now has 560,000 PhD in a year, the world's first. Aren't this a living ghost? Ten and nine are fake! 
Legal corruption and gray corruption, all doing business selling diploma, this is China. The whole university education, and even the master's and doctoral education of postgraduate students, is that's what it looks like. 
GLOBAL Outlook: So, have you personally been in school for so many years, have you ever expected from China's educational reform? 
Han guanqing Kaili: Hard! What is a University? 'Freedom of thought, spirit of independence.' 'College scholars, non-building also, masters too.' 
I went to the North Post Administration Institute as president in 2000, and was also ambitious at that time. At our inaugural conference, my speech was 'Striving for the establishment of Stanford University in China.' I said that Tsinghua is known to be China's MIT, Peking University called China's Harvard, and we BeiPost will struggle to become China's Stanford. After two months, I wouldn't dare to mention this again. 
When I was the dean, I started discussing in the hospital, 'whether the students serve their teachers or teachers serve their students', and I couldn't talk about it later. It's like we've been talking about whether officials are going to disclose personal property since the 80s. The truth is clear, but now more than two decades have passed, and there is little result. Under the current system, vested interests are difficult to touch, and it has formed a very solid institutional structure. 
Zhu Qingshi, Chancellor of the Southern University of Science, said that China's universities need to reform, the first is to de-administratize, and the second is to achieve university autonomy and professor and manage schools. The current system is not working, and principals are assigned above. If a government cadre was transferred to work, there was no place to place for placement. He added a deputy principal in the school, and then he was waiting to mix up to retirement. 
In accordance with our Higher Education Law, the university operates a system of responsibility of principals under the leadership of the Party Committee. What does this mean? My comment is: the leadership is not responsible, responsible does not lead. Under the leadership of the Party Committee, is the principal responsible system, this principal, or is it not up to this responsibility? 
I agree with Zhu Qingshi, go administrative and teach the school. Deng Xiaoping engaged in the reform of the rural system to contract production to the home, saying that it is just one sentence: 'I believe that farmers will cultivate land.' In the same sense, the government should trust professors to teach, rather than relying on officials of the Ministry of Education, officials from the central government to direct them. Therefore, if we are to hope, the reform of university education must follow the path of deadministration, university autonomy and professorship. 
Now that our universities are mainly public universities, the government has a duty to pay. Why? Because it is the government's responsibility to train people for society. However, the Government has no right to intervene in all aspects of the school, from administration to academia, even in the era of North Ocean warlords. 
Since the reform and opening up, some people shouted the slogans of the industrialization of education. But is there any money around the world that relies on education? Education is a social good in itself and is aimed at promoting the development of society. Western famous universities, even many private schools, have absolutely no dividends to shareholders. The boards of private universities are hired social celebrities who represent the public interest, who decide what our approach is and how to best serve the community. 
Now China's universities have become a system that makes money. School leaders are all officials, at deputy ministerial level and bureaucratic level. In this way, Chinese universities are the goal of two words: one is the right and one is money. Qian Xuesen's 'Question of the Century' is: 'Why are there no masters in Chinese universities?' What masters are cultivated by such a university is simply a tear. Our university has become a pig farm, pig selling money and completely losing the spirit of college. 
GLOBAL OUTDOCK: So the last question, where do you think the way out of Chinese students? Under the current system, what advice would you give to Chinese students and parents? 
Han guanqing Kaili: This proposal is really not very good to say, I'm afraid to go out. 
In the past, I argued that I should work in China for a few years after studying at primary, secondary and university levels, and then go abroad to study postgraduate students. In this way, you can take China's problems to study abroad, and return to study can be useful. At that time, this could be said to be the case for our generation. However, today's harsh social environment in China and the level of corruption in schools is far greater than in the 1980s. So, I now advocate sending the children out of junior high school in the country. At this time, he has been in contact with China's culture and basic knowledge, and he does not need to accept the torture of the college entrance examination and waste youth. 
The bigger problem is that in my country it is now difficult to develop basic morals for children. I had a graduate several years ago, and her child was three or four years old and sent to a kindergarten in full care. It was also a good kindergarten, and it took them a lot of money to send it Monday morning and pick up home on Friday afternoon. But every Monday morning, the child is crying and crying. Once again, the child was holding his mother's leg at the front of the kindergarten, crying and refused to go in. At that time, the kindergarten aunt came out. The child saw the teacher out, suddenly climb up from the ground, wipe the tears, and said to the aunt, 'Teacher, I come, but think of you!' Imagine that parents look next to the heart shocked: our children, such a young age, have learned to say false words and shoot horses! How did he become this? That's because, only then, can he survive in the environment. 
I also had an early 'sea return' friend, a company in the country for more than 10 years, and was very successful. However, he finally left China with his family. I asked him why, and his answer was: for the children. We're not meant to make the child become famous in the future, he said, even as a cleaner. But let him be a good man, be a happy person. After several years of hard work, we found that this is already difficult in the domestic environment, not even teaching children the truth. Little children grow up in such an environment, it's easy to become two-sided factions. Do not say happy anymore, having a normal mental state is difficult. What to do? There is no way, only to leave.

[Attached] Beijing University of Political Science and Law: Materials of the Small Anti-Party Group headed by right-wing Kuang shaoyi Shaoyi (1957.10)
I. Brief introduction of small group members
1, Kuang shaoyi Shaoyi: right-wing, landlord family origin, family members are mostly reactionary Al-Shabaab members. I have always opposed the party after coming to our hospital. He is the leader of the small group 'academic union', and the organizer of the third party. He is the general secretary of the party. 
2, Wang Kai: right-wing, landlord's family origin, father was a pseudo mayor and deputy officer of the reactionary army, fled to Taiwan before liberation, and graduated from the pseudo-police school, now Taiwan. After working in 1949, I have been concealing family circumstances and opposing with the party after coming to school. I am a major member of the small group 'Learning Alliance' and the Secretary-General of the Third Party. 
3, Wu Guizhi: right-wing elements, landlord's family origin, came to school to resist the party's education, publicly abused and attacked the party, is an active activist of the small group 'learning alliance'. 
4, Jia Hongshun: rightists, young students, poor peasant components, have serious individualism and arrogance ideas, blurred positions, closely followed by the right and party opposing. 
5, Cao Shulan: Young students, staff of family origin, because of the ambiguous position, serious individualism, at the encouragement of right-wing elements Kuang shaoyi Shaoyi and Wang Kai participated in organizing the third party. Under the use and encouragement of Kuang shaoyi, he served as general secretary of the party. 
6. Fu Chengzhang: The right-wing element, although he did not directly participate in the small group 'academic alliance' and the third party, but he usually has close ties with small group members. In addition to his personal series of anti-party activities, he has always actively supported Kuang shaoyi, Wang, Wu and other anti-party activities. 
Second, the organization of the reactionary small group
Because right-wing elements Kuang shaoyi Shaoyi, Wang Kai, and Wu Guizhi are all extremely dissatisfied with the Party, their positions are consistent, and their actions combine each other, and often walk together, drink alcohol and whistle. So gradually formed a small group. In December 1956, three of them decided to form a Philosophical Science Research Group, led by Kuang shaoyi Shao-yi, and Wu Gui-zhi as secretary, and attended by Jia Hongshun. Started to be named 'Allied'. Later because the name 'learunion' was too explicit, it was renamed 'non-Zu Ge Meng'. And decided to keep the secret. Kuang shaoyi feared exposing the problem of the 'academic union', and asked Wang Kai several times, 'Have you told others about our problems?' 'Why should you tell Yang Meili about the science team (Yang is Wang Kai's girlfriend)?' 'You can't tell us about Yin Shuibo (Yin is a support).' etc. 
Their secret group appeared as a 'scientific group', ostensible studying philosophical theory and writing articles, but secretly engaged in various anti-party activities. In order to cover up opposition activities, Kuang shaoyi Shao Yi stressed that every meeting had to make false records, and said: 'With such a record, we are not afraid to check.' 
Kuang shaoyi Shaoyi told the purpose of organizing the secret group: 'When I started to set up a scientific group, I wanted to organize a third party. I thought it was good to use this form, and I was prepared to use the scientific group as the sprout of the third party. 'My purpose of organizing the third party is to fight against the party, the party chamber, and thus achieve the purpose of replacing it...' said, 'I have two motivations and purposes for organizing the third party, one is political ambition, and I think that with a political party, having the power to do it well, I can be a leader. The other is that I think socialist society is not a good one, and the form of social development is more than one Short, so socialism will soon finish. At least 200 years, I organized the 'Third Party' to fight for another 'higher social system'.' 
The group held five secret meetings from December 1956 to April 1957. The group participated in the group leader Kuang shaoyi Shaoyi and Secretary Wu Gui-zhi, team members Wang Kai and Jia Hongshun. 
After the beginning of the wind, the small group aggressively attacked the party, Kuang shaoyi Shaoyi took the opportunity to formally organize the 'Third Party'. Kuang shaoyi Shaoyi said: 'In the past, I have organized the idea of a third party. Wang Kai told me that people at the People's University had set up a social democracy party. I thought it was very good. One day I went out for a walk with Fu Chengzhang, Wu Guizhi and Wang Kai, and raised the issue of organizing the party.' 
Kuang shaoyi Shaoyi once said to Cao Shulan: 'The wives of the cadres have a lot of wages. We want to prove that the Communist Party has changed. We ourselves organize a political party to fight for communism.' 
On a Sunday evening in early June, Kuang shaoyi Shaoyi and Wang Kai and Cao Shulan also talked about the issue that the Communist Party has become spoiled, and they want to organize a party. They also talked about the theoretical basis of the 'party', development targets, party platform and other issues. 
On the issue of the name of the 'party', they have studied twice and not finalized; the division of labour is made by General Secretary Cao Ren, General Secretary Kuang shaoyi Dangfu, Secretary-General Wang Kaitang, (Cao Shulan revealed: 'In the division of labor, Kuang shaoyi Shaoyi called me to be general secretary. He said, 'You become general secretary, you have no problem. ''), 
On the theoretical basis of the 'party', Kuang shaoyi said they only believe in the dialectic law, which is absolute truth, and other Marxinism is no longer necessarily applicable;
On the subject of development, they intend to develop only university students, first at the university. Then develop outside the school through relationships such as students, lovers and other relationships. Undertake concealed development, until a certain period of time. At that time, Cao Shulan also proposed to develop the most 'brave' and 'upright' college students. 
III. Specific activities of small groups
In addition to the five meetings of the small group 'Academy Union' and the organization of a third party during the whole period, they also carried out the following anti-party activities. 
A), carry out provoking differentiation activities

ã€Attachment 1ã€‘Cai Ciming: 'Healthy'
Health, Zhengding County, Hebei Province, born on August 14, 1911, 1931, after the '918' incident, joined the anti-imperialist alliance in high school school, began reading Marxistist writings and accepted revolutionary ideas. 
In 1935, admitted to the Department of Journalism, Yanjing University. 
March 1936 participated in the Chinese National Liberation Pioneer Team and joined the anti-Japanese rescue movement. 
After the 'Seven Seven Incidents' in 1937, he voted from Rong to join the Eighth Route Army on the front line of Taiyuan, joining the Communist Party of China in November of the same year. During the war of resistance against Japan, he served as a cultural instructor, company instructor, head of regiment education unit, head of Brigade propaganda section; in the period of the liberation war, he served as Director of the Political Department of the Brigade, a Political Member of the Trainer and the Minister of Advocacy 
After the founding of the country, he served as Minister of Propaganda of Guizhou Military Region, member of the CPC Guizhou Provincial Committee and Vice Minister of Propaganda Department of the Provincial Committee, Dean of Guiyang Normal College, Dean of the Provincial Academy of Social Sciences and Party Secretary, and adviser to the provincial Academy of Social Sciences. He is a member of the Standing Committee of the Sixth People's Congress of Guizhou Province, deputy chairman of the Education, Cultural and Cultural Health Committee, and deputies of the 7th Provincial People's Congress. During a 16-year military career, Health has experienced the transition from guerrilla warfare to the military corps. In the war of national liberation, the People's Liberation War and Guizhou Qing bandits anti-domination and land reform movement, he was a pioneer, physical strength and became an excellent military administrative cadre. He worked in political ideological work characterized by creative and research-oriented research, inspiring the morale of the troops and disintegrating the enemy, ensuring his ministry. The completion of the team combat task, by the superior award. 
In June 1952, he was subject to organizational arrangements and was relocated to his place of work. During his tenure as Dean of Guiyang Normal University, he earnestly implemented the Party's education policy, seeking truth, respecting and caring for intellectuals, mobilizing and exiting their talents, and striving to cultivate talents of moral, intellectual and comprehensive development. In conjunction with Guizhou, he actually established a strategy to enrich undergraduate and expand specialties, enrol in Sichuan and Dian provinces. In four years, he expanded the Guiyang Normal College from the original four departments and two departments to six 11 subjects, enabling the College to take a new scale in faculty, student staff and teaching facilities and equipment, both to meet the urgent needs of high schools in Guizhou in the early stages of the founding of Guizhou. The requirements of teachers have laid the foundation for the development of higher education in Guizhou. 
In 1957, health was treated unfairly. 
February 1958 was delegated to provincial traffic machinery repair plant as deputy director. 
In January 1959, Fengjiao prepared Guizhou rubber factory, responsible for infrastructure work. 
1960 Deputy Director of Guizhou Rubber Factory. He studied rubber technology and was directly involved in the design and construction of the plant. In a construction blasting accident, the head was hospitalized, the injury was not healed, and went to the site to direct the construction. He poured his own hard work for the development of Guizhou rubber industry. 
During the Cultural Revolution, he was persecuted, but he had a firm communist belief, and his flagrant opposition to Lin Biao and the 'Gang of Four' reversed and won the respect of a vast number of cadres and workers. 
In April 1979, he served as party secretary and dean of the Guizhou Academy of Social Sciences. Under difficult conditions, he established 'based in Guizhou, facing the whole country' policy, and focused on solving the theoretical and practical problems of socialist two civilizational construction. on. In their work, focus on research and research, theories relate to reality, open up and expand scientific research fields, find talents and train talents in practice, so that both basic theoretical research and applied research have achieved great achievements, and also cultivated a number of scientific research cadres with potential, and lost for party and government organs and other institutions. sent a group of leading cadres. 
In March 1984, he retired from the second line and left in autumn 1988. Health has been engaged in political propaganda education and social science research work for many years, has served as the chairman of the senior title of Guizhou Province social science research series, vice chairman of the provincial education committee of primary and secondary school teaching materials validation committee, member of the provincial government advisory committee, provincial committee of agricultural research institute special researcher, province President of Sociology Research Association, President of the Provincial Institute of Gerontology and other social positions, for social science and economic development in Guizhou Contributed. 
Health causes died on 31 July 1996, at the age of 85. (Cai Chi Ming)

(Appendix 2] Guizhou Provincial Committee of the Communist Party of China: Resolution 1958.2.12 on Expulsion from the Party)
In November 1957, the provincial committee held a four-level cadre meeting and after this meeting, the provincial organs propaganda, cultural and educational system party cadres and all party members of Guiyang Normal College revealed the serious mistakes made by the current provincial committee members and the dean of Guiyang Normal University health. According to the information revealed and verified, the mistakes made by health are mainly manifested in the following areas:
(1), On major international issues, it has always adhered to the bourgeoisie nationalist position and revisionist views, distorted and defamatory propaganda against the Soviet Union, the anti-revolutionary riots in Hungary in October, the Sino-Soviet relations and relations between the socialist countries. In this propaganda, health and health completely negated the great achievements and advanced experience of the Soviet Union in the socialist revolution and socialist construction, negated the great contribution of the Soviet Union in defending and developing the socialist cause and the cause of peace throughout the world, and distorted political life within the Communist Party of the Soviet Union. slandered Soviet foreign policy and Soviet just support for other socialist countries; he put Hungary in October The anti-revolutionary insurgency was described as 'the result of the dogmatic study by Hungarian leaders of the Soviet Union and the Soviet power chauvinism,' saying that 'Naji is right', describes the Chinese people's learning of the advanced experience and achievements of the Soviet Union as 'superstitious Soviet' and the relations between socialist countries as vulgar And provoking propaganda, explanation. Health propaganda on relevant international issues is not conducive to socialist international solidarity and the international solidarity of peace-loving peoples throughout the world, but undermines those solidarity. This propaganda of health is a serious violation of party discipline and has had a bad impact among teachers and students at Guiyang Normal College. 
(ii), In the 1957 'magnification' and anti-right struggle, sympathize with and support the reactionary rhetoric of the right and encourage right-wing groups to attack the party. In 'Zoom on Ming', Kang jian spoke on the 'trification' (aimed at stigmatizing party members and activists), written by Zhang Ruzhou, a right-wing member of Guiyang Normal College, Zhu Houkun, etc., at the provincial committee publicity work meeting and teachers' symposium (aimed at attacking the Party's intellectual-policy, knowledge), The reformation of the ideas of the molecule and the 'three anti' and 'anti-counter' movements), Wang Shengfu posted a large print (aimed at stigmatizing (The main comrade in charge of the provincial committee), for the fallacy put forward by some right-wing elements in the Wenhui Bulo that 'the Party Committee should withdraw from higher schools' and 'professors to manage schools', all considered 'very reasonable' and greatly praised. After the anti-right struggle at Guiyang Normal College is about to begin and health has learned about the spirit of the anti-right struggle, the right elements of the students, Nazhiliang and Liu Zhixiang, have initiated the establishment of an 'Inspiring Committee for Improving the Political Status and Material Treatment of Teachers' in the Institute, in an attempt to create the current teachers 'too low' and 'indifferent' public opinion on political status and economic treatment, inciting teachers and students, and even the whole Provincial and national school teachers rose up to 'big democracy' in order to carry out their anti-party and anti-socialist conspiracy; for the conspiracy of this right-wing group, health not only sympathizes with their reactionary rhetoric, but also actively contributes to them and supports and sponsors their actions. Both before and after the inception of this reactionary organization, Health has published sympathy and support conversations. At the school's student representative meeting on June 3, the right-wing elements Nazhiliang, Zeng Qiang and others raised an appeal to society for the issue of the political status and material treatment of teachers, and their health immediately applauded and urged them to quickly adopt the Appeal; when the meeting adopted the Appeal, they raised their hands in high health., Applause. Following the adoption of the Appeal, the reactionary arguments in the Health Think Book were insufficient, instructing right-wing elements to collect 'concrete and compelling material' to be supplemented by the provincial education union (health chair), and instructed the College Office to support funding to bring the Appeal The book, 'Hundreds of copies sent out' (in fact, 300 copies have been distributed throughout the country), in order to expand social outreach. After the anti-right struggle started at Guiyang Normal University, health and many aspects exonerated some right-wing elements in the institute, arguing that party members and activists 'put the red flag too high'; some right-wing elements were criticized by the masses, and he hurried to shake hands and compensate for crime, saying, 'You have been frightened for this month and a half.' It turns out that, in the fight against the right, health has completely lost the position of a Communist Party member and coincided with the right-wing elements. Health is not only an active supporter and advocate, but also an actual participant, for the right-wing group of the Committee for Enlightenment of Political Status and Material Treatment of Teachers. This rebellious act of health has caused serious damage to the authority of the Party at Guiyang Normal College. 
(3), Unorganized, resist leadership, brag about individuals, fight comrades and treat Guiyang Normal College as his personal 'independent kingdom'. Since 1952 as president of Guiyang Normal University, he has always held a resistance to the leadership of the provincial committee, provincial committee propaganda department and ministry of culture and education, using 'top back' and 'hold the door' methods, so that certain important instructions of the Provincial Committee cannot be implemented in Guiyang Normal College. He often expressed his reluctance to attend the meetings convened by the provincial committee, believing that participation in the meetings of the provincial committee delayed his teaching and learning of science. He has consistently adopted arrogance and confrontation at meetings convened by the Ministry of Culture and Education of the Provincial Committee. After the establishment of the Party Committee of Guiyang Normal University, even after the Eighth Party Congress passed the new Party Charter, Health still insists on implementing the 'one-long system' on the leadership of the work of the college. Many important issues are not discussed by the Party Committee, i.e., by individuals decide and announce to exclude the Party Committee. Unified leadership and supervision for the work of the College. In a healthy mind, the party committee is only his personal affiliation; he openly said to comrades of other higher schools: 'The party committee meets, you agree with me, this is the party committee system; you do not agree with me, I will do it according to the old law, or a long system.' On all occasions, health always boasted itself, trying to create personal worship among the masses. He had decided to make June 12, when he entered the college and started rethinking of its teachers, to occupy himself as the founders of the Academy; and even allowed and praised among the masses for his great stay with Chairman Mao, which was posted in the hospital's poster on the hospital's poster. A portrait and sing to his verses. Health and Health has consistently taken an attitude of exclusion and blow to some of the older Party members and cadres who work at Guiyang Normal College, saying that they 'don't understand pretend', 'are outdated', 'to be eliminated'. They cannot build socialism and run higher schools, saying that they work there is a 'backpacking'. 'Poking holes', satirical, abusive and hitting them, making it difficult for them to work and want to put them a One place to get out. In order to combat the old cadres, he even used harsh means of drawing up a group and combating a group of people. To some comrades in charge of the provincial committee and the responsible comrades of the Provincial Committee's Ministry of Culture and Education, they constantly spread some rumors and rumors; he even deliberately created public opinion within the party in an attempt to bring down the responsible comrades of the Provincial Committee's Ministry of Culture and Education. The bad attitude of healthy treatment of organizations and comrades is a reflection of his extremist individualistic thinking of the bourgeois. His misdeeds seriously violate the party's principles of organization and undermine the unity of the party. 
(4), In practice, there has been a consistent distortion of the Party's policies and policies, and manifests itself as a serious right-wing opportunity. In the work of intellectuals, health distorts the approach of solidarity, education and transformation, underlining the solidarity side in a one-sided and isolated manner, while ignoring and abandoning the aspect of education and transformation. In the opinion of health, intellectuals have been transformed, no longer need to be reformed. He thinks that intellectuals have always been 'unable to eat', and now it is time for 'intellectuals to come to power' and 'workers and farmers to step down.' He thinks intellectuals 'have learning', and then reforming, will hurt their self-esteem. As a result, health is always good for intellectuals, and rarely criticizes and helps them. In the work of intellectuals and cadres, he always emphasizes only operational competence, regardless of political quality. His direction to students is to move away from actual and political direction; the path he takes is actually the path of 'teaching the school.' In the 'fight against' work, especially in the late part of this work, health became a surrender, and it was totally wrong to 'counteract'. Health always holds a skeptical attitude towards the Party's policies and policies, and exaggerates certain shortcomings in actual work, and distorts the Party's policies and policies. He always looked at party documents and newspapers from the opposite side and did not believe in party calls and instructions. He distorted the 'three anti' movements, ideological reform movements and the Party's rectification movements, and negated the achievements of these movements. Here, a healthy anti-party, anti-socialist stance was fully exposed. 
Based on the above facts, the Provincial Plenary considers that the health error is extremely serious: he has betrayed the party's principles ideologically, politically and organizationally, betrayed Marx, Leninism, and the proletarian revolutionary cause, and became an anti-socialist bourgeois right. In order to clean the organization of the Party and the serious discipline of the Party, the Provincial Committee of the Provincial Committee decided to abolish the healthy provincial committee members and his other posts in the party and remove healthy party membership; and recommended that the concerned parties abolish all healthy administrative posts. 
The Provincial Committee of the Plenary of the Provincial Committee believes that the position, views and his ideological style on all the above issues are the reflection of the bourgeois class essence. Health so it is not accidental to fall into the right. Being born from the family of bullies landlords, has personally participated in the exploitation of landlords, and has long been educated by the bourgeois and imperialist slavery education, becoming a bourgeois intellectuals. Before the War of Resistance against Japan, health was politically speculative in order to defend its class interests, once joined the KMT, and later joined the KMT's reformed faction. By the outbreak of the anti-Japanese war and the rise of the popular rescue movement, he was mixed with the Communist Party with the idea of political speculation. According to health and health himself, when he joined the Communist Party, he was skeptical about the party, believing that the party did not believe in intellectuals and brought 'class dissent' into the party. As a result, health, when joining the party, brought two characteristics from his origins and history: the bourgeoisie ideology remains intact, and political speculation. After joining the party, Health has experienced 20 years of revolutionary struggle. In the long revolutionary struggle, health must not fail to expose his class nature, causing a serious struggle between the party organizations and his misconceptions. Historically, the most prominent problem of health is his self-interest, bullying and oppressive ideological style. In order to fight his bad style, the party organizations have focused on him in the various winds and all-party movements, seriously criticized and educated him. However, whenever this is the case, health always refuses to receive party education by using false reviews and mixed past methods, and the reactionary position of the healthy bourgeois has always remained unchanged, only because he sometimes shields it in the form of 'left', sometimes disguised it with Marxist-Leninist words. The main thing is to confuse it with his speculative two sides, so that it has not been exposed for a long period of time. Its true face. It was until the Chinese revolution entered the current stage of the socialist revolution, when international and domestic cattle gods attacked the revolution together, the healthy anti-party and anti-socialist positions and views were fully exposed. Thus, health is an untouched bourgeois, a class dissidents and political speculators who have long been hidden within the party. Guizhou's party organizations exposed him from the party's leadership bodies and is the victory of the Guizhou Party in the whole wind movement. 
The Provincial Committee is of the view that party members throughout the province, especially members of intellectuals, should learn from the mistakes made by health:
(), Health is a 20-year party member. Because he insists on his reactionary position of bourgeois, refusing the party's education and transformation, finally embarked on the road of anti-party and anti-socialism, becoming a right-wing element. This shows that a Bourgeois intellectual-born party member must go through long and severe class struggles in order to get a radical transformation of his mind and a fundamental change of position. Ideological transformation depends on the education of the Party and the education of the masses, but the most effective is its own consciousness; the education of the Party and the masses will only work through the consciousness of one person. To transform ideas, they must be honest, and they cannot be false at all; whoever wants to be false will deceive himself. For 20 years of joining the party, the party cannot say less about his education, and because he has no such consciousness and has always made false falsifications, his bourgeois reactionary stance remains untouched and cannot stand the serious test of class struggle. Within our party, the idea of the bourgeois is incompatible with that of the proletariat; to be a true communist member, the bourgeoisie's minds must be cleared. After the system of exploitation had basically been eliminated, all sorts of bourgeoisie thought became the enemy of the socialist revolution and socialist construction, and the most prominent manifestation of bourgeoisie thought among intellectuals was individualism of all kinds. In our party, many comrades are intellectuals. For intellectual-born party members, special vigilance should be given to the idea of bourgeoisie individualism, otherwise they will also embark on a healthy path. 
(ii), Our fight against health mistakes is a two-way struggle on the front of political theory and the struggle to defend Marxism and anti-Marxism. The healthy conduct of anti-party and anti-socialist activities always cloaked the coat of Marxism. It now seems that the position and views of health on some major international and domestic political issues prove that he has always been a revisionist. But for a long time, people were confused by his cloak, until the critical juncture of the socialist revolution, where we went through anti-right struggles and increased political vigilance before exposing him from his coat. It is clear here that our fight against the enemies of anti-socialism on the political front must simultaneously fight all revisionists on the theoretical front. If we are to win the two-way struggle on the political and theoretical fronts, we must tightly grasp the revolutionary theory of Marxism and Leninism. We must step up theoretical learning, improve our theoretical level and identify against me, wrong and authenticity on the theoretical front. Any revisionist view is anti-Marxist and anti-socialist, and we must fight them resolutely. 
(3), From the health mistakes, an unreformed bourgeois intellectuals always oppose the party's principles of organization with extremist individualism: individual prominence against the collective leadership of the party, with decentralization against the unity of the party, and liberalism with Party discipline The confrontation, even by sectarian activity, the organization of the separatist party, confrontation with the unity of the party. The confrontation between individuals and organizations, requiring organizations to obey individuals, or as long as individuals and not to organize, is a manifestation of the instinct of bourgeoisie individualism, which aims to create organizational chaos and weaken the role of the organization in order to realize individual ambitions. The principle of collective leadership of the party, the principle of democratic centralization, individual obedience to the organization, subordinate subordinate, and the whole party obey the central government are important principles that maintain the unity and unity of the party from the organizational standpoint. Without these important organizational principles, the Party cannot have unity and unity, and it will not matter the party organization. The party loses everything and completely lost its combat power. For this reason, the enemies of the party always try to conspire to destroy our party's cause from our party's organization, and the idea of bourgeois individualism within the party is the basis for the enemy, which is to say: to preserve the party's principle of organization, is to preserve the life of the party; we must cooperate with those who violate The party's principles of organization and violations of the Party's discipline are engaged in a resolute and serious struggle. 
The Provincial Committee of the Plenary believes that the issue of health has educational significance for the whole party, and the resolution is communicated among all party members. Healthy misconceptions have had an impact in higher education schools, and the Provincial Committee's Plenary called on the party organizations of higher schools to take measures within and outside the party to completely eliminate the influence of such misconceptions. 
Adopted unanimously on 12 February 1958. 
(Compilation of Decisions on Purging the Right in the Party (1), Executive Office of the Central Committee of the CPC Central Committee, 1958)

ã€Attachedã€‘Hebei Tianjin Normal University: 'The Opposition of Kang mingyao, Wang Xueqi, Liu Weijun Small Right Group' (1957.5)
Among the faculty members, Kang mingyao, Wang Xueqi and Liu Weijun formed small right-wing anti-party groups in the Jiusan Society, using the Jiusan Society for anti-party activities. 
(1), Kang, Wang, Liu anti-party, anti-socialist right small group
Under the leadership of the Party Committee, the three democratic parties in our house 933, the Democratic Progressive and the Democratic Revolution formed a joint bridging group at the end of July to carry out the anti-right-wing campaign centered on the anti-right. From August 1 to September 10, this stage, we have launched a struggle against Kang mingyao, Wang Xueqi and Liu Weijun, the core elements of the anti-party and anti-socialist right-wing group of Jiusan, Wang Xuechi and Liu Weijun, and invited the Department of Fine Arts, Chinese, and History within the Jiusan Society Branch. Some teachers participated in the assistance and held nearly 40 meetings, both large and small. In the summer season, all the teachers who attended the meeting were untiring and fighting to defend the party and defend the path of socialism. Mr. Yan Lichuan, a teacher of the fine arts department, said this when he was invited to the struggle: 'There are right-wing elements there and I hit there.' During this stage of anti-right struggle, the face of anti-party and anti-socialism of the Kang, Wang and Liu right-wing small groups have been completely exposed because they always abide by the instructions of the Party Committee and insist on the rational struggle with facts and rationale. Wang Xueqi, the behind-the-scenes leader of this small right-wing group, who is cunning, stubborn and concealed deep, has always taken a two-sided approach, good at disguising his original face, and finally had to lose in front of the facts and plead guilty. Kang Ming Yao once said this: 'Reason has put me down.' 
Anti-Party and anti-socialist right-wing groups with Kang, Wang and Liu at the core have consistently used the opportunities they consider available to conspire to engage in criminal anti-party and anti-socialist acts. Using the opportunity to help the Party to rectify the wind, he launched a crazy attack on Marxist Leninism, the core force leading the construction of our motherland-the Communist Party of China, the ideological weapon that guides us-in an attempt to abolish the leadership of the Party, destroy Marxism, and restore old China. However, Wang Xueqi and Kang mingyao, the core elements of the right-wing group, have repeatedly carried out cunning and trying to mingle with the crimes committed. They only admit: 'Our words and deeds are not conducive to the cause of socialism. Now it seems or raised to the height of principle to analyze it is anti-party and anti-socialist A righteous nature, but there is no motivation for anti-party or anti-socialism.' Wang Xueqi further denied: 'I am not anti-party, not anti-socialism, but some unconscious mistakes.' The comrades present at the meeting made a strong struggle on the basis of a lot of facts. Comrades pointed out that they are deeply abhorrent to the party and to the new society. Wang Xueqi once said: 'There is no freedom of speech and no freedom of silence,' and made a hackling-like saying, 'Uh! Um! That's not the old.' 'There is no freedom of residence, no personal freedom, the Constitution is a dead letter,' said Kang Ming Yao. Liu Weijun said: 'Communist Party rule is violence and foolish policies.' They tried to restore the situation in old China, viewing the anti-revolutionary Hu Feng as a martyr. They are well aware that to revive the path of old China, to which they were in love: the Communist leadership must be abolished politically, and Marxinism must be abolished ideologically. To that end, they carried out a series of conspiracy activities. At the political level, they first controlled the leadership of our branch of Jiusan Society, as a tool to use the policy of mutual supervision of long-term coexistence and mutual supervision, and wanted to bring the claws into the leadership of various units in order to exclude the leadership of the Party. They tried to serve as director of the teaching and research group and participate in the departmental committee and journal editorial committee. Active activities have been carried out to that end. Kang mingyao advocates the abolition of the school party committee system, and Wang Xueqi is more blatant in favor of dissolving the Communist Party. In terms of thought, defaming Marxism-Leninism, Kang mingyao said: The dialectical law is manipulation, how is it reasonable to say. Wang Xueqi said: Ma, En, Lien, and Stus are all right. They also launched a comprehensive attack on the party's literary route: opposing the direction of serving workers and farmers, Wang Xuechi said, 'Hu Feng's theory where there is a life there is a struggle is right, and the writer should write what he is most familiar'. Kang mingyao, while cursing popular works of art, oppose the idea that there is no superclass humanity in class society. Wang Xueqi said: 'The work now has no human taste so it is not touching.' 'The art works are just illustrations of the theme,' said Kang Ming Yao. Liu Weijun wrote more openly articles that criticize the definition of Engels realism. In order to counter the leadership of the Party on the literary route, and in order to systematically attack Marxism, they used the hundred families to actively organize anti-party journals in the name of the nine three school society, using the policy of one hundred families to contend with all flowers, in an attempt to establish anti-party positions. In order to realize the above anti-party and anti-socialist conspiracy, they do not hesitate to take advantage of the wrong policy of the vicious and great development of the central center of the Jiusan Society, and develop their members according to their own private wishes, with the despicable means promised by the officials, in order to strengthen their power. They were more rampant during the magnification. Liu Weijun actively supports and incites 'Wen Sanyi Group' to attack the party. Kang mingyao, for his part, encouraged the right-wing, Wang McRod, to enchant his vicious anti-party remarks, saying that he was a good man in Shandong. Wang Xueqi scattered all over Liu Weijun's anti-party and anti-socialist rhetoric from the study of 'Re-talk', and praised him. At the same time, Wang Xueqi attacked the party committee secretary and the Party Central Committee. He said: 'The Chief Personnel Officer (Secretary Li and), should be responsible for combating the problem. Why didn't anyone give advice to the Director of Personnel. [Attached] Kang Ping: Democracy, Freedom, Sectarianism and More (1957.5)
Editor's note: Kang Ping is a Power Department student of Chongqing University. Landlord was born, and his father is subject to mass control in land reform. After the opening, he spoke many times at the colloquium, a lot of poisoning, saying that the party had been too fierce in the past, so now there was such a lot of whims; the party looked too heavy on the composition, was mindful, was the reactionary view of the thief's son is a thief; he opposes the evaluation of Comrade Stalin should pass 37, Stalin's mistake It is a 'late' view that Stalin has interfered in Yugoslavia's internal affairs, is a tyrant, a political ambition, and so on. In this article, he carried out a vicious attack on the new society from several aspects such as democratic freedom, the rule of law, and intellectuals, and described the new society as a dark one; at the same time, he also provoked the country's relations with the Soviet Union and Yugoslavia. 
Democracy and Freedom
Is there democracy and freedom in our society? I don't dare to say too sure. But I like democracy, I like freedom. And some people, in his opinion, do not like democracy, especially freedom, just like hating stinky dog dung. They confuse freedom with liberalism, anarchism, bourgeoisie thinking, and opposing freedom and discipline. What are the consequences of these arguments? Bring the trialism to the spread of these years, brought the deathy of academic thought, and brought the formula and conceptualization of the monopoly on literature and art. Last year's general election, I proposed that way of being less democratic, someone first gave me a stick and said I wanted to promote a capitalist campaign. It has been said that elections need to be democratic in substance and not formal. But it turns out: without democracy in its form, there is no substantial democracy. Last year's major elections, some say Xiao Yuanxia was inappropriate, and the result was suppressed. At the time of election voting, the people turned into machines that would only raise the pen to circle. 
The constitutional freedoms of expression, assembly, association and the press are not guaranteed. Most of the power of the press lies in the hands of party members, and articles that are out of track cannot be published at all. Want to go out the wall? Want freedom of assembly and association? Beware of giving you the last instigation sin. The rule of law does not exist in our country. Judges adjudicate the case subjective, kill, and forgive. The director of a sports committee in Guangzhou, insulted a cadre's personality, violated human rights and forced the death of a person. As a result, the court sentenced only one year suspended prison sentence. It was really officials who took care of. A party committee at a construction site in Chengdu forced a couple of lovers to commit suicide, and afterwards anti-slander said, 'Suicide is to cover up its political reactionary nature.' Although there were fewer people who made mistakes and persecuted people after liberation, the bad things they did did did did not strike the people worse than the Kuomintang. In the past 'East is not bright', you can 'go to the West', but a few years ago, a musty fell like falling into hell, never 'superborn'. When I was in middle school, I had suffered a crackdown by a Turkish Emperor group, and when they came to a great deal, they had a political problem with some material down from the sky, as if not pushing me into hell. And what did they do? Take a teenage high school student to fight, saying that someone else is in love and takes others down to Guizhou (forcing others to kneel to confess), suspicion that others steal things, and then forced others to drop out of school and take drugs afterwards. They really lost their goodness, but they have always been on the verge, by members of the team and party members, by the deputy director and the principal. What means do they make? That is: licking fat ass, long tongue; pedal someone else's pain feet head heavy. They crawled others in order to climb up. Naturally this kind of person is very few, but 'a screw can break a pot of soup', their power, we can't eat. The reason why such individual deeds are so lawless is because of unequal treatment, people have no rights, they make big mistakes and are not subject to legal sanctions; they make minor mistakes and do not review them. I hope our dear party will pay more attention to the illegal behavior of these impurities in the future. 
As for the high definition of intellectuals, I think there are also historical roots. When the Kuomintang, the intellectuals are not accustomed to their corruption. After liberation, the intellectuals were high because they were not valued. Intellectuals are told to care about politics, but they are allowed to raise their right hand (shouting slogans), give intellectuals freedom, and keep them in cages. In particular, there are some so-called intellectuals, full of brain-shell bean kara, only know to run with someone else's ass to fight upright intellectuals. So some intellectuals became Tao Yuanming, went to 'dengdonggao to Shu Xiao, Linqing stream and give poetry'. 
sectarianism
Sectarianism is the most dangerous among the 'three hazards', and it is serious to hurt the people of the country. I agree with the ancients who said that sectarianism was born with a sense of exploitation. Because of sectarianism, there was a privileged idea of party members, some impure elements, saw the profit of joining the party, they did not hesitate to brag the horse and climb, their goal was not communism, but money, beauty, status. No wonder some girls look for objects to form three members (party members, technicians, 80 yuan), a long (section chief or director, etc.). 
My views on some international issues
After Tito's speech last year, it caused a strong reaction from communist newspapers. We also wrote the article 'On the proletarian dictatorship' and criticized it. I agree with the criticism, but I think Tito's speech has a desirable part, for example, that socialism should have democracy and humanity, which cannot be denied to him. As for someone who said it was good in the past, I think he was covering Stalin's wrong route. 'Tito receives both Soviet aid and US aid,' the minister said. Is a two-sided approach, is for money.' I think it is a bit insulting to others, not in the interest of unity, and negates the diplomatic character of others. 
For the economic assistance given to us by the Soviet Union, I am grateful for this selfless spirit of internationalism. But I also think there are some individual experts who bring in addition to some internationalism, but also some chauvinism. I sincerely hope that chauvinism will be thrown away, so that the unity of the Chinese and Soviet people is closer and more sincere. As for, some middle and lower cadres in our country, the kind of blindly worship, the style of hard lifting is quite worth correcting. They only knew the phrase 'learn from the Soviet Union', they only brought the backward experience of the Soviet Union, and they signed and called execution in the factory and mine; there was a problem with the technicians and called the technicians responsible. Technicians really fell musty, were seen as rice barrels, hangers. I want to be unfair, I want to respect technicians, respect intellectuals.
